My request was denied by Singapore Airlines because I was an adult. No other reason. I escalated my request but each and every time my request was denied. Of both the Low Sodium and Low Fat options I ended up selecting, each and every meal was fish which by my return flights was frustrating due to the repetitiveness and that I'm not a big fish fan. Not a big deal most people would say however during my flights back to Australia I became ill because I could barely eat any of the food. One flight didn't even have any fresh fruit available. Singapore Airlines have subsequently advised that in future I can have the Child's Meal but I won't be taking that chance after being repeatedly denied on both my outgoing and incoming flights to Australia. The lack of flexibility with the meals and the lack of imagination in the meals has turned me off.

Title: Flown with them numerous times and they are great
Content: Flown with Singapore airlines probably 20 times or more and they have always been great. Admitedly most of the time has been on business class. The really good thing about this airline is not only is the service and quality really excellent, it is consistently excellent - not like the others who are good sometimes but not others, Food is great, entertainment is great, service great. Cant praise them enough.

Title: Terribly disappointing for a reputed airline
Content: Flew from Melbourne to Singapore and return. Uncomfy seats (you could feel the lumps and bumps in the seat) and old, tired and grotty planes on both sectors. Had to use the wet towels to clean the tray table, etc. Ended up with a rash on my lower arm (contact point) which was against the arm rest. Worst airline meal I have had (and I am an ex flight stewardess). Out of Melbourne a choice of two hot meals but nothing else on the tray other than a cold bread roll. No salad, no dessert no crackers and cheese and no bar service either. Just a tray of juice, beer and sparkling wine. I was shocked. Asked for a bottle of water and was told they don't serve bottled water. Beware - tank water on an aircraft is deadly. Managed to get one from Business class and was told "SQ was cost cutting". In this day and age - not serving bottle water is ridiculous. Breakfast prior to landing was another awful meal - eggs or curry noodles. Stale fruit salad (just about 5 tiny pieces of fruit), cold bread roll again. Return sector was a tad better with the dinner service. Breakfast was bad though with a hot egg meal and rock hard cold muffin. Flight attendants were very new on both sectors - one on the return was outstanding even though she had only one month under her belt. Asked for bottle water to be given the same story but she sourced a few sealed cups of water from left over meal trays and brought it over. To cap it off - extremely obese pax given a seat in the center and he could not even get into the first isle seat leave alone the center seat. So I had to swap seats. Now the ground staff would have noticed this on check in and should have made arrangements to accommodate him. They are quick to take your money for an extra leg room seat or offer you an upgrade if you are willing to pay - likewise they should either weigh these overweight pax and charge them extra and cater for them too. I would have been in strife if we had an emergency as I would not have been able to get out in a hurry. I sat for 8 hours without even a washroom visit as he had fallen asleep and was too big to move. Don't mean to discriminate however we do have an issue with an overweight population and they make it very uncomfy for their fellow pax. He was practically spilling into my seat and I was cramped. The crew could not offer me a change of seat due to a full flight. So you pay full fare and have half a seat. SQ is one of the more expensive airlines these days - so expected a promise of a great flight and in-flight service and was looking forward to this trip as I was flying SQ after a very long time - never again if I can help it.

Title: Bad online support, pretty bad food
Content: I booked my flight through a flight partner (Virgin Australia) and before this trip I didn't know how flight partners worked, all it did was give me a headache. I wanted to book in my seats, normally you can do that online, however I was unable to do so either through Virgin's website nor through Singapore Airline's. I called Virgin and they told me I need to speak with Singapore. I called Singapore and requested seats. That worked fine. However on the flight over I didn't realise that sitting right at the back was so noisy, I wore earplugs the whole flight and could still hear the noise, but that was fine, I learned my lesson, but when breakfast came, I was the very last person to be served they ran out of the edible meals and the other meal was some kind of fish (which smelled too strong for a confined space). I normally am one to enjoy all kinds of basic airplane food and am really not fussy, but this was too much. Fish (stinky) for breakfast? I actually was really unhappy because I never got a choice. Knowing all of this, I decided to change my flight home seat booking, so I wasn't the last person on the plane right down the back near all the noise. I emailed Singapore airlines with the request as soon as I landed. It took a couple weeks until they responded with a stock email saying I need to contact Virgin. I emailed back saying Virgin cannot do this as they dont have access to the seating plan, it is Singapore's job and I know as I have done it before. The email response that returned was the same stock email as they had sent again. This time I was really angry and re-iterated that they should PLEASE read the content of my email. Third time and I received the same exact response again. This was now 1 month after my original request (lucky I was away for 6 weeks). I had to find a way to call them while overseas (which was a who other headache...) because this was not being resolved online. So I called them and had a very long difficult conversation trying to get the guy to help me as he really wasn't actually listening to what I needed and I was getting frustrated. He finally put in the request for me to get the seats changed and when I told him about the food last time he said he could also request a no seafood meal. So I thought great, Ill do that. On my flight home, the seats were all good but this time I discovered that requesting a non seafood meal means that they dont give you any option at all whatsoever, you just get the rubber eggs, even when the meals being served are chicken or beef with no seafood options! When I asked if I get to choose the normal menu as it already is non seafood, I got an abrupt response about taking the meal from someone else. Gosh I had no idea about all this rubbish. So I learned a lot of things this flight. That Singapore Airlines have terrible online support and rubbish food and no matter what I did it didn't get better. I hear all these great things about Singapore and its probably fine if things are going ok for you but when they go wrong, they dont help you, not without a lot of effort and frustration any way. I will not be using them if I can help it, in the future. FYI I was going to make a complaint to them on their own site but after going through all I did with their online support last time I feel like its pointless and I am probably wasting my time as no one reads the emails (I can assume). Also remembered one more thing, on my flight back all the movies I tried to watch had Asian subtitles that were embedded in the movie (as in you couldn't turn them off) and as I had watched all the TV shows of interest 6 weeks prior on my way over and no new ones were on there. I really couldn't watch them because not only the subtitles were really distracting, the movies were also really low (low low) quality and to me they were unwatchable. Needless to say nothing went right for me on the flight with them.

Title: Great customer service!
Content: I had to reroute my flight to Istanbul due to the latest events . My tickets were non refundable. I found Singapore Airlines very understanding and sorted my issue very quickly and efficiently. A big thank you to Charlotte from QLD office.Very impressed!

Title: Perfect comfort
Content: Outstanding Service by Singapore Airlines Pilots, on board flight SQ224 (Perth/Singapore) On the 18th of may 2016, Special thanks for their safety during rough weather, A warm and special thanks to Chief Steward Vincent hay Chong and crew team. 75th birthday celebration always will be remembered with great happiness, outstanding team many thanks from 37A/37B An Award winning airline, I would travel even on my own, "Totally trust pilots, And all ground crew " Keep up your status of being Number( 1) Airline in the world. ( I VOTE Singapore Airline 5 1/2 Star Rating) Daughter and Mother look forward to flying again on the 30th of August 2016, as we hope to have this crew team and pilots that we trust so very much in, Thank you once again for the outstanding high class service. I Name Singapore airlines "The Golden Ibis of the skies" (RTM)

Title: Singapore airlines Nightmare!!
Content: Had to make ticket change - support is in Cebu Philippines what a mess! ! Had to repeat myself continously and in the end they had to refer me elsewhere for amendment. Totally frustrated totally crap. I will NOT fly with Singapore unless no other alternative.

Title: Terrible terrible call centre service from India
Content: Tried to book my 6 hour Terminal 2 overnight hotel stay with someone in an Indian call centre. The person handling my call was useless. I regret to say this type of poor service really lets SIA down and should be reviewed. Just found out the Indian call centre chap tried to book me into a Bangkok hotel, yet I am in transit at Singapore. Amazing. Wrong city, wrong country. Do I try again or do I give up? Well I did call again TWICE and things have become worse. This time, like always their automatic payment system fails. This system has NEVER EVER WORKED for me yet. So it took me three tries to book the transit hotel. Amazing. What a time wasting disgrace.

Title: 8 hours without a meal!
Content: My experience with Singapore airlines was not good and I will never use them again. The service is very average and the meals (when you get them) are NOT good. I think when you are flying in economy you can't expect first class food but with Singapore they fed us when we got on the flight and then we waited 8-10 hours before receiving our next meal. Although they provided snacks in between it is not good enough. I don't know about you but eating biscuits and chocolate bars for 8 hours does not make you feel very good! I do have to give them some credit though as when we said we were starving they brought us a tiny bread roll each with more chocolate bars. If I can give Singapore Airlines any advise I would strongly suggest they have at least 3 proper meals for a 14 hour flight! 2 is not enough and having to deal with jetlag is bad enough, don't feed your guests crap so they feel even worse. We don't pay $1,000 a flight to have cold beef curry and chicken in some weird brown sticky sauce.

Title: Problems and we have yet to take off!
Content: My wife and I are booked Premium Economy with Singapore, flying from Sydney to Phuket and return. I have to say that "Manage your Booking" on their web site is absolutely hopeless. Sometimes it will accept the booking reference, and others not...and when you succeed, you do not always get all of the booking. Most annoying though is that part of their product offering for Premium Economy and above is "Book the Cook"...but the most the web site allows is "Standard Meal"...none of the advertised offerings under Book the Cook are available. Even more annoying, some weeks back I managed to use the "old web" site, and chose our meals. Now the old web site has been turned off, previous selections have disappeared....and we can't fix it. And there is more! You can only advise/complain about the situation via a online form which I have filled in days ago. I bet the response is never received. By the way, their smart phone App is equally useless. I am a Qantas Club member and am trying Singapore because they offer more suitable flights to Phuket and elsewhere. Maybe I should return to Qantas, as their online service is far superior.

Title: Customer service
Content: Call centre staff couldn't be worse. They can't understand basic English so just pray you don't have to make alterations to your flight. Any request made over the phone is met with a long 15 second silence by the operator until they repeat what you just said back to you only with the wrong details.

Title: Great service
Content: Booked Melbourne-Frankfurt flight with Lufthansa and ended up on Singapore Airlines on the Melbourne - Singapore leg which I didn't mind at all. Flew by myself with my 17 months old. On the way to Singapore all bassinets were booked so the lady at check in gave me a row of three seats without asking, so my son could sleep on the two vacant seats. I had booked a special meal for him which was served before mine, which was excellent so I could feed him before eating my meal. My son unfortunately discovered the call attendant button and kept pressing it but nobody was annoyed by it. They kept turning it off with a smile. On the way back we were given a bassinet which was handy. Everyone was again extremely nice and helpful, asking questions about my son. Again his meal was served before mine which was breakfast and just some jelly. The business class attendant came past and saw it and asked if a wanted a bread roll or toast instead for him. I agreed and she got him a roll. When he waz finished she came back, told the other staff to serve me my breakfast and she took him into business class so i could eat in peace. That was great customer service. Once in Melbourne we had to wait for our stroller, the whole cabin crew walked past us and kept waving to us and calling my son by his name which he loved and I appreciated. Again excellent customer service. Made my trip with a toddler by myself much easier. Greatly appreciated

Title: Big Rip off, bad food & rude call centre
Content: I was regularly flying with Singapore. Recently I paid $1450 for return ticket from India but had to cut my trip short due to family reasons. I paid $700 extra for booking a seat for closer date. But couldn't travel so I cancelled it but Singapore airlines refused to refund any of this $700 and tried to make excuses for everything. Then I asked to put me back on my original return date then they charged me $200 more for that. I had to pay because I had no option. please ask every question if have any doubt before booking with them. They just want your money that's it.

Title: Ground crew staff charge US$500/kg excess baggage
Content: My hubby just checked in to fly home today (13 May$ from Jakarta, the Singapore Airline check in staff asked for US$500/kg for the overweight baggage, when I check with Singapore Airline call centre, it should be $38/kg). I wonder how they train their staff? Oh the reason given by the check in staff is Brisbane is far from Jakarta. I bet if Singapore Airline check with the staff, they will say its US$500 for all not per kg but hubby has confirm several time just in case he heard wrong and by the way its 6kg overweight so the math will not add up to US$500 too and no hand carry!! My hubby also think the weight was incorrect as after he put his luggage, the reading keeps changing and the check in staff just took the highest read. This is ridiculous, hope Singapore Airline take this seriously and don't allow such corrupted behaviour.

Title: Singapore Airlines hopeless in resolving issues on board.
Content: On a long haul night flight (12 hours), I was unable to recline my seat as the man behind me was blocking it with his knees. He had his seat reclined. I asked him to move his knees and he replied "No". I called the cabin crew for assistance and they were absolutely hopeless. They asked him to move his knees, he said "No" and then they told me (not asked me) to move to another seat - away from my husband. I asked if we could move to be together and was told "No, you are the only one with the problem" - unbelievable!! Also, my daughter, her husband and two children were recently on a flight to Japan when a drunk male passenger became loud and abusive and his language was disgusting. Several passengers asked the cabin crew to intervene and you know what they did? They left the cabin!! Some other male passengers then remonstrated with him to no avail. He carried on abusing everyone and still no sign of the cabin crew. They have absolutely no idea on how to deal with issues and have obviously had no training in this area at all. If you can't rely on the cabin crew to resolve issues then it makes for a frightening journey. The worst of it is that when I complained in writing about my experience the cabin crew lied. They said that they offered to move us both but that we declined, can you believe that? Of course not! Never again Singapore Airlines - you've just lost six frequent flyers!!!

Title: won't fly any other airline
Content: I flew from Perth to Amsterdam with a toddler and the airline staff were super helpful. My son fell on the first flight and bruised his face badly (not the airline's fault). The airline staff were very supportive and tried to accommodate us in every possible way, even at Singapore airport they asked if we were alright. We were able to change seats and meals were served when it was convenient for us. On the flight back we arrived at the airport with less than 40 min until departure due to unforeseen delays. The airline opened up the check in counter and did everything to get our luggage onto the plane in time; they remained very friendly despite us being so late. Overall, I received excellent service from them. The only thing they can improve is their phone line customer service. They did not answer the phone despite it being office hours and when my partner asked the Perth office to forward a message to the airline ground staff at Amsterdam airport they were very reluctant to do so. In the end, the airline staff never received our message. I won't fly with any other airline on any long haul flights from now on.

Title: I do not recommend flying with Singapore Airlines!
Content: I recently had 4 flights with Singapore air - from Brisbane to Singapore, then Singapore to Seoul and return. I had previously liked flying with Singapore air but now I am put right off! I did not like the food so I ended up only eating the bread the whole time. Secondly, there were no air conditioning vents above our heads! For long haul flights this is terrible!! It became incredibly stuffy and hot inside. Just terrible!! I could not sleep at all the whole time as the seats were uncomfortable and there was no leg room. I had the sorest bottom no matter how I repositioned myself. And last of all, I understand this is outside Singapore Airlines control but all 4 flights were turbulent (and the first 2 were very turbulent). I never used to suffer from motion sickness before but I felt queasy and anxious. It was just awful. I will never recommend Singapore Airlines again.

Title: rude and unprofessional customer service on ground
Content: Feel Cheated and disappointed with rude and unprofessional customer service received from on ground staff at Adelaide airport.Always traveled with Singapore airlines and recommended to my friends and family but not anymore. I was charged AUD483.31for extra baggage at check-in and on my asking for the reason for charging this huge amount staff could not provide me with satisfactory answers. Further to my disappointment, received an email reply from Singapore airlines customer service department to justify the amount charge and just a sorry for rude staff's unprofessional dealing with customers. Never ever going to travel with this airline again in future. Stuck, this time, thought would have pleasant travel and instead of considering any other airlines with cheap airfare as compare to, Singapore airlines would be better but it all turns out to be, was a BIG MISTAKE. ON GROUND RUDE STAFF AND UNPROFESSIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Title: Horrible for infants
Content: Did not bother about an infant at all. Provided the wrong seat without the promised bassinet. Family seats were given to a young women where the bassinet usually fits. My wife was provided with the middle seat with a in a standard row. Horrible service as no one cared on board and the call centre in India pretended to listen but didn't care about service as it was an on board issue. Really poor communication for anyone to comprehend the trouble. Avoid this expensive airline at any cost when with a family.

Title: Terrible transit service at Changi airport for passengers with disabilities
Content: I am not totally disabled, but at 80 years of age, I am in need of transport assistance when transiting through a large airport like Changi particularly when a change of terminal is included. A request for such service seems to fall on deaf ears within SIA and SATS. There is no information readily available on how a passenger can obtain access to the SATS Gateway service who seem to operate a fleet of electric buggys. Yet the airport boasts of providing a seamless transition for passenger with disabilities transiting at Changi. The publicity for the airport is obviously written by a young media savvy official who has looked at disability recommendations and written a web page saying the right things, but in fact the service element is non existent in reality. But as others have said SIA management are so arrogant they just ignore any complaints by passengers regarding poor service.

Title: Terrible reservation call centre now based in India
Content: I am based in Sydney, Australia and I am a Singapore Airlines frequent flyer. Until about November 2015 I can call the local Australian number to get flight changes. These calls are channelled to Singapore Airlines call centre based in Singapore and I was able to make flight changes easily. Now I find that my Australian calls are channelled to Singapore Airlines call centre based in India and in the past week I was appalled at the service standard of their call centre. I booked a flight from Colombo to Sydney online and when I wanted a change of flight date I was asked by the call centre to call Colombo directly at my own cost. My calls to Singapore Airlinesl local phone number in Australia would not be diverted to Colombo and I was asked to spend my own money to call Colombo. Calls to Colombo from Australia are highly expensive.  I am now going to cancel my Singapore Airlines booking though I would lose money. I am now looking to fly by some other airlines. I am a Krisflyer member and had always used Singapore Airlines for the past several years and even recommended Singapore Airlines to my colleagues. I will never recommend Singapore Airlines to anyone.

Title: Standard plummeted over the years...
Content: I've been flying SQ for the past 20 years and it's very sad to see Singapore's National Carrier decay in standard. Generally, I don't think there's much to complain about in service. It's dropped since the 90s, for sure but they started off with a very high standard to begin with and it's still miles ahead of other national regional carriers. I fly both Business and Economy and while the Business Class product generally has nothing to complain about, it's lost its ability to "wow". The flatbed is awesome but the service is beginning to tarnish. It used to be that a Sing-Beijing flight they'd serve 3 meals and you'd come off the plane a few kg heavier. Now a Sing-JFK flight and they serve the same # of meals and you feel it's a good weight loss programme. Recently (Nov 2015) took a flight back from Haneda to Singapore. Boarding was at 8:30AM and landed 4:30 Changi. To make an 08:30 flight you wake up at 5:30AM and get to the airport or 4:30AM Singapore time. Little chance to grab breakfast. For the entire 7 hour flight, they serve ONE meal, breakfast. Not even full meal, a very light breakfast (Croissant + eggs + beverage). There are some peanuts, etc. but only one meal. I told the chief steward how ridiculous this was. I informed him I was diabetic and he empathised but told me the meal plan and decisions to do so were set by HQ DESPITE feedback from them. I asked him if he thought it was reasonable and confidentially, he said the flight crew themselves bring something on-board to tied them over to 4:30PM. He was even kind enough to bring me a cup noodle around 2PM. I thanked him but asked him how did he think the other passengers felt about this meal plan.  So yes, I understand it's out of his hands but when did SQ decide to make such a glaring omission just to save on $$ and improve their return? How could "The world's best airlines" make this sort of mistake and despite feedback from customers and their aircrew, continue to perpetuate this mistake? I checked with my travel agency and it wasn't a crap class fare but full Economy class fare and it made me wonder how much profit does SQ require in its operations? The Flight load was near 100%, it looked like mainly people flying for business. There were some Japanese touristy looking passengers who might have been looking forward to the legendary "SQ Service". I'm pretty sure they came away underwhelmed and eager to publicise their experience through Social Media. It would be unfair to give SQ a 1 star rating when there are many other airlines deserving the "terrible" rating but the 2 star "Bad" rating is to signify the fall of SQ as a premier airlines. This is a bungling of management and they should be ashamed for the decay in standards and for falling so far short of the legacy they were left.

Title: Good Except The Food Poisoning
Content: My family flew back yesterday from Singapore to Sydney from our Xmas holiday. I was impressed with Singapore Airlines staff. The only thing that has changed my opinion is the terrible food poisoning I now have from the chicken served for dinner. The chicken was cooked through but was served totally unheated. Not a nice way to end a holiday.

Title: Excellent customer service onboard
Content: My partner and I had a wonderful great experience when travelled with Singapore airline business class from Singapore back to Melbounre. Highly recommended for their patience and excellent customer service onboard.

Title: Great customer service from Singapore Airlines
Content: Our recent 8 day trip to Bali in November turned into 17 days due to volcanic activity from Mt. Rinjani. Due to work commitments at home and two return flight cancellations, we had no alternative but to book return flights via Singapore with Singapore Airlines (at a cost of nearly USD $2000). At the last minute we ended up flying home with our original airline, so cancelled our Singapore Airlines tickets. Within two weeks of our return we received a full refund from Singapore Airlines (less a $500 cancellation fee, which we will claim back through our Travel Insurance company) without any hassles or having to complete a mountain of paperwork.  Thank you so much for your excellent customer service Singapore Airlines!

Title: SIA is slowly fading away from its former glory
Content: As a Solitaire PPS with SIA for almost a decade I have decided never to fly with them again. The service is now so poor, the food is inedible, the seats hard and uncomfortable (and I am talking about business class) and the attitude of the airline stinks. Having written to the airlines of my concern and getting a typical "we don't care" response it is time to move on. After more than 100 flights all over the world with SIA I think I can safely say that in all respects they are joining the ranks of US carriers in their declining service. Good bye

Title: Disappointing
Content: After hearing how good Singapore Airlines are I booked my flights from Sydney -Singapore - Singapore - India - India - Singapore - Singapore -Sydney in November/December 2015. The first flight had us stacked in like sardines in a can so not a comfortable flight at all, leg room was terrible and to top it off I had a larger passenger over hanging my seat space. The second flight from Singapore to Delhi was ok. We flew three internal flights within India on Air India and Jet Airways with great leg room and service. On our homeward flight from Mumbai to Singapore our flight was delayed by nearly 6 hours - there was no information until you arrived at the gate ready for boarding - at this time the staff came around the air port and talked to people for the first time to make sure we were awake ready to make the flight. Singapore air lines provided a meal - the most disgusting food I have had, no choice at all, just a veg or non veg meal slapped on a plate with a cup of diet coke!!!!! The meal was some sort of chicken in terrible gravy with rice. I would have thought a meal voucher would have been more appropriate so you at least had a choice of what you wanted to eat instead of this unhealthy meal. This meal was fit only for the bin. The flight once we finally got on was ok as it was not full and we managed to get exit row seats so leg room was fine. The toilets smelled dirty, the air craft looked as if it was not well maintained as far as dirty walls down below - my screen was chipped and very tired. I won't be choosing Singapore airlines next time as I think they are letting their service slip because they have been top of the list for so long. There are many more carriers out there who have good reviews which I will be going to next time I fly.

Title: A classic example of poor service
Content: So I was informed by Singapore airlines that they had cancelled by flight out of Koh Samui due to operational issues and they would pit me on another flight which was 2 hours earlier. As I explained to them I was unable to take that flight as I had no boat out of the island u less I hired a private boat. They then said they could put me on a flight for the next day however they would not pay for my accommodation. So here I am stuck with the choice of taking the earlier flight and paying for a private boat or staying an extra night and paying for my accommodation. SQ would not compensate me and expects me to be out of pocket. I'm really disappointed at how u treat your customers. Your lack of trying to rectify the situation you created. 5 calls all saying the same thing. What a waste of time. Definitely not a great way to fly and definitely not how a customer should be treated.

Title: Success has gone into their head.
Content: Rude and arrogant cabin staff, with preconceived ideas of dealing with various nationalities/people. I would not touch them with a barge pole.

Title: Cancellation of flight after etickets were issued
Content: I booked and paid for return flights from Brisbane to Kuching Via Singapore for two adults 5 weeks ago using Skyscanner/ Helloworld websites flying SIA Brisbane/Singapore sector and SilkAir Singapore/Kuching sector. Etickets was issued a day after booking and therefore made all other preparations and hotel booking. On 16/11/15 I received a text messages from SilkAir informing me that my return flight has been rescheduled from 06/12/15 to 04/12/15 and asked to contact my Travel Agent. No reason was given. My agent called me the same day but told me he could not help me because I had to return after 05/12/15 as my purpose of going there was to attend a wedding on 05/12/15 and therefore asked me to call SIA direct myself. I called SIA call centre the same day and was told that I could return on 08/12/15 and would reimburse my two days extended stay but told me that it had to be referred to the relevant Department for approval first and it would take one to two days. I was very happy and thanked that guy for kindly helping me. No reply was received after two days and I had to call again and was told I could fly on 08/12/15 but nil reimbursement would be given. Of course, I cannot accept the cost of my two additional days in Kuching so I asked them to find alternative solutions e.g. By Malaysian Airline flight on 06/12/15 even though I did not want it and paid more to fly SIA and SilkAir in the first place. After long arguments, I have been told that they would try to do it but would take 1 to 2 days. The two days expired 3 hours ago and I still have not heard from them. I am furious that my fully paid flights can be cancelled or rescheduled without my agreement. If this is to be rescheduled or cancelled by me, they would imposed huge penalty on me. Where is the fairness !!! I just cannot accept that this is the customer service of SIA. At this time of writing, I am still waiting for their call. My departure date from Brisbane is 27/11/15 and there is not many days left. I sincerely hope that SIA management will read this review and attend to my request immediately. 	 Traveller information Traveller 1	 THIENSUNG VUN Airline Ticket Number:	 6189763575141 Traveller 2	 Airline Ticket Number:	 6189763575142 Update 06 Decemeber 2015: Further to my earlier review regarding cancellation of my flight schedule, I wish to inform everyone that the Call Centre is totally useless. They will tell you all sorts of excuses and promises and that they would do everything for you but from what I have learnt so far, they do not have any authority at all. They also make you wait for hours, you have to explain everything from the beginning again and again every time you call and they never will call you back. I ended up submitted my complaint through the SIA website and eventually they sorted it out for me but I will never recover from the difficulty and stress that I had to go through the call centre and I will try never to fly SIA again.

Title: Just Horrible, Cheating And Disgusting.
Content: I still do not know why so many people extending 5 star to SIA. What I have been through in my last 3 flights to and from Perth was something horrible. I just do not know how to tackle this situation. It has become constant practice or SIA to behave disgusting with customers because they know nothing is going to loose their business because there are people who always need to fly. The Perth based customer service is just a stupid group of morons, who does not give a damn to any of your problems. They always keep you confined with endless issues and kept lingering on. After all my previous and horrible experiences with SIA just recently, I have booked SIA again because there is not enough connection available to the city I am travelling in South Asia. I already have booked my ticket online (using SIA website) have received an itinerary, but have not received the Eticket. The next morning when I called the customer service based in Perth, at first the lady was very abrupt and was treating me like [censored word removed]. She put me on hold three times for more than 8 minutes each. NO DRAMA. She told me hurriedly that the previous ticket booked is not available on her system however, she can view that a ticket was generated the previous under my name and she told me that it has been cancelled for some unknown reasons and money will be returned in 3-4 weeks. I have booked the ticket again, this time I have had received my eticket when again I called the customer service and, guess what when I explained about the previous so called cancelled ticket to this new customer care guy, he said YES< there is a confirmed ticket under my name, so now I have 2 tickets. What a drama. I can't believe that SIA is incorporating such malpractice and unfair business dealings with clients but now I am considering taking this matter to Consumer Protection Department. For me, this is just disgusting and sad too, coz I don't know how many people may be going through such horrible experiences. July 6th 2016 Update: Seriously rotten staff and cheap customer service After submitting my last review please consider this one as part 2 of the previous version. Perhaps the incident occurred at the Perth international airport terminal and just outside the Singapore airlines boarding gate is so painful and disturbing which has actually affected my overall health and mental status. Whilst I was ready to board on my flight to Singapore on the 11th of January 2016 in the morning I was carrying an extra air bag with me. This bag I thought to carry with me alongside my laptop bag which was a small laptop bag. When they announced the boarding, passengers started moving towards the gate ready to show their boarding passes. I also queued and started walking slowly towards the boarding gate staff. Once I reached at the counter to show my boarding pass one of the Singapore airlines staff virtually snatched away the boarding pass and shouted at me, what's the weight of this extra bag? Sounds like they were keeping an eye onto me. I simply said that it may weight approx 8kgs? Then that guy who has beard called other people using his radio and they all took me aside shouting at me. Imagine my situation that everyone has gathered me from all around and have grabbed my bag. Somebody is saying so who is going to pay for your extra luggage? I did not say anything. They one guy took away my laptop bag by force and weighs this.......shouted from a far....this bag is 9 KGS. Then another lady came and said straight away, either you pay extra for this bag, throw away few things or else we are going to cancel your boarding pass right now. She also threatened me that I will have to miss this flight and go back if I have not paid the amount immediately. In that situation I was just shocked and started throwing out so many things from that bag.....as I have few make up kits for my little sister's marriage and few other things..... believe me or not I have emptied half of the things from the bag within few minutes. Imagine my situation that I was virtually sobbing in tears begging them to please help me but instead tbey kept humiliating and insulting me. Finally. Everything was happening before hundreds of passengers at the airport but no one came forward even to ask them to behave. Finally they charged me $650 approximately and allowed me to board the flight. They also took away my other bag which was not even locked. Upon arrival on the destination I found that the other bag seal which was a simple one found broken and so many of valuable gifts are missing. As I have to participate in my sister's marriage I did not let my parents knew about this incident. A new mini iPad, a Samsung Galaxy 4, a Gucci ladies watch all gone. Perhaps the SIA people targeted me after going through my first review before this new one. I m not worried about whatever I have been through but imagining a similar situation makes me feel horrible and stressed that I can't believe. I already have decided to take this matter to appropriate government body not only to get justice but also to uncover those people who have humiliated and insulted me. Friends I just am not biased with SIA but whatever happened with me has made my life just painful and horrible. Thank you all for taking time in reviewing this article.

Title: My experiences
Content: The first couple of times I flew ti Spain on Singapore air I was very happy with service cleanliness I really couldn't fault anything then i after a couple of years I went back on singapore and was very disappointed my seat was dirty they didn't come around with any food for 10 hrs I was starving by then I really was shocked I don't know if it's about cutting cost but Singaporeair you better wake up I'm going to give another go this year so I'll just wait and see.

Title: Singapore airlines are the best
Content: Recently I flew from Singapore to Sydney in business class and I experienced the best business class products I have ever seen. The cabin crew were very attentive and nice the bed was comfortable and the movie selection was impressive.

Title: Premium Disappointment
Content: Earlier this year Singapore Airlines introduced Premium Economy (PE) class to flights from Singapore to Frankfurt. So I booked PE on one leg of the flight and paid. Weeks later I learned that PE would not be available on my flight. The airline did not reimburse me and also did not want to book me onto a different flight where PE seats were available. I was offered a voucher instead to do my own upgrading with, on a different part of the flight. The voucher never arrived. In six phone conversations in as many weeks, I was told each time that the voucher had been posted. It still did not arrive. Searching the internet for similar cases I learned that customers who suffered the same fate received their vouchers one day before departure. With PE seats always booked out well in advance those vouchers were useless. After two more weeks and further pleading with the airline to either reimburse me or use the money to upgrade me to PE on another leg of my flight, the answer was still the same: they can't reimburse or upgrade me, because a voucher has/will be sent. I kept calling and insisted to either receive a voucher via email or an upgrade while I waited on the phone. After putting me on hold for 45 minutes, they agreed to upgrade me. For me, booking the new PE with Singapore Airlines was premium disappointment. It took 2 months and a lot of stress to finally just get what I had paid for. This is a face of Singapore Airlines that few people might know.

Title: The Best Airline in the World!
Content: I have traveled on SIA since 1974. My experience on almost 90 flights since then to various parts of the world confirms that their service and attention to detail is faultless. Their flights always leave on time.The planes are impecabbly clean. Their ground staff, cabin crew and their service personnel are a pleasure to deal with. Changi Airport is a marvel in Airport design and people flow. I refuse to travel with any other airline!!

Title: Worst call centre service
Content: This is the third time this year I had to call Singapore Airlines reservation hotline 13 10 11. Time and time again they provided very lousy service: (1) the staff spoke with heavy Indian accent, which I could barely understood. (2) very dull voice and mumbling throughout the conversation (3) were not understanding the price structure and could not answer my questions about the price difference between online price and her price. Eventual I called Melbourne office and their price matched internet price, which is $180 cheaper than the Indian call centre's quote. I wrote to Singapore Airlines 6 months ago about this. None has been changed. Very disappointing! They seem to forget about customer impression's touch points that [Name removed] consulted them!

Title: No inflight Entertainment
Content: No inflight entertainment on my seat due to broken audio output on A380 13hour flight. I am happy to accept that the flight was fully booked and it is beyond their control, if customer service was appropriate. It takes 6-8 weeks, Lufthansa manages to get back to you within a week. That's very poor and leaves me questioning whether they have a general quality/ customer service problem. Next time I will fly Lufthansa again on the same leg.

Title: Fantastic flight and service
Content: First time on Singapore Airlines was in November 2014 and was very impressed with the service and professionalism and the friendly flight attendants. But what I found was the Next Gen economy seats on the 777 aircraft, they are very uncomfortable and I could not sit on it any longer than 5hours without a sore bum. I would fly Singapore Airlines but I won't fly on the 777 Next Gen seats. Sorry Singapore Airlines but get those horrible seats recushioned. How could anyone make an airline seat with such bad cushioning, the next gen seats are supposed to give you more personal space which it does and heaps of leg space but the down fall is the part your backside sits on, it makes your back side painfully sore after around 5-6 hours of sitting on them. i found even after i got up to move around for awhile then return to the seat i could not even sit on the seat. i can fly for 14 hours without moving from my seat normally but not with the next gen seats. Come on Singapore Air i would love to fly on your airline as the service and entertainment systems were great but i can not sit on those next gen seats. all they need is extra padding on the cushion as the rest of the seat is great. Just a tweak to get it perfect and you will have the best seat in the economy class. Service impeccable, 777 er300 seats bad.

Title: Great Service, Terrible Food
Content: Flew Singapore from Brisbane to Singapore recently. Service was fantastic, food was awful. Some weird brunch combination of breakfast, a main meal and desert. Worst food I have ever been served in business class by so far it is not funny. Seats are old now, although were state of the art in about 2005. Pricing is a lot cheaper than Qantas etc. If you are happy with economy standard food in business class, then maybe a Singapore Airlines ticket is good value.

Title: Poor Customer Service
Content: I am trying to talk to someone - anyone in Singapore Air. I want to book a flight using points. Service is not available over web as using partner airlines. Despite spending 10 hours on the phone last week and having 2 promises a a return phone call, nothing has happened. Singapore Air call centre is a joke. DONT FLY WITH SINGAPORE AIR

Title: Food poisiining
Content: After Flying in from Singapore on the 8th of October with my husband - I have spent the last 30 hours in bed with food poising. I only had one meal of chicken croissant - which my husband didn't. Their b'fast into Sydney was appalling also. I did write on a napkin which I saw the flight attendant give to her supervisor. No one came to ask if I would care for anything else. Bad service.

Title: Worst booking service and communication problem between offices in country
Content: Never will book tickets with Singapore airlines again. They did not assist my mom when she traveled from India to Australia. She had knee injury and also can't speak English which was mentioned many times and in Sydney airport no body helped her with luggage nor they helped her find way out pathetic. If you need to change dates they charge you again and again even with the availability of seats. When you call office to enquire every time they have new rules generated in explaining why they charged. Pathetic never book again....

Title: Bad Customer Service and No meal
Content: After missing out on a meal on not only one flight but two in a row on the flight to and from Singapore, I complained to Singapore Airlines online. This took 33 days for a response which basically said we are sorry but this does happen as we adjust meals to customer feedback (What the). I suggest you go with another airline between Brisbane and Singapore as they can not even feed the whole plane.

Title: Customer service
Content: I am trying to book a flight online and want to find out a simple question. So i called and was directed to music where no one ever answers even though its supposed to be 24 hours. I emailed 3 times, no one responds. I have flown with them before and its good, but this is bad customer service so i am going too fly with another airline

Title: True professionals
Content: I have never had a bad flight with Singapore Airlines. Along with Philippine Airlines and for shorter trips Cebu Pacific, they are my favourite. The Singapore staff on board can sometimes go through the motions but the best ones (often, surprisingly, males) can be truly excellent. The planes also are renowned for their punctuality - better than Qantas. But best of all by flying them you avoid the dowdy Middle Eastern airports. Show a bit of class by going via Asia to Europe, not via Dubai or other horrible airports.

Title: Singapore Airlines Is AWESOME!
Content: My wife and myself have flown Singapore Airlines twice in the past and they have lost our luggage twice so we will be going for a hat trick. Their inflight service is second to none, I will happily fly with them again and again and again. Our luggage was reunited with us within two days of arrival at our destination and we were also given money to buy clothes to tide us over. We have nothing but compliments for Singapore Airlines for looking after us so well. I think that the people who have complained so terribly about this airline need to take a good look at themselves because maybe half the time it's their own fault that they find themselves in that situation. I say again Singapore airlines is AWESOME!

Title: Lack of Food and Service for 12 hour delay by SIA in their Home Base
Content: Returning from Europe to Sydney, we sat in an A380 on Singapore Tarmac 4 hours. We were offloaded back into the airport at 1 am Singapore time on the night of 25th/26th June, 2015. After some hours we were told we would be loaded onto another plane at 7 am next morning. No accommodation was offered. We were told if we wanted food (having missed out on dinner) to walk back to Burger King (almost a kilometre) and present our Boarding Passes for S$15 worth. As I'd caught a Euro bug and was feeling sick, & have hip and back problems I did not wish to walk to Burger King, as such food would have made me sicker. A single skimpy blanket eventually arrived after several requests. Other food arrived at 4.30 am after one was obliged to attempt sleep on a metal airport lounge. Not good for a painful back. We took off for Sydney at approximately 8 am. The food offered on the flight home was inedible. We eventually arrived in Sydney around 5.45 pm Sydney time. I was very disappointed with the lack of service overall. I remain unimpressed.

Title: Singapore Airlines business class: don't waste your money.
Content: I flew business class on Singapore Airlines from Sydney to Singapore last 24 July 2015. Paid more to do so. Average check in, excellent lounge (good food, personal service), comfortably wide seat on the A380, excellent food but service from attendants was far from average. Was not offered bread during lunch, was not offered the second meal service that was listed in the printed menu, and was not given the Singapore arrival card so that I could fill in on board. The service I used to get from the "Singapore girls" on economy class long time ago is gone! Distant, unfriendly and simply inefficient. A far cry from the service I got on business class on Air Canada, Air China and Lufthansa during the past three months.

Title: Dissapointed !!!
Content: Checking in from Bali with an amazing piece of art and having 2 transit flights ( Bali -Singapore - Istanbul- Athens ), I begged to take this woodcraft with me in airplane. They denied to me ( and tried to persuade me that putting the sign "fragile" could give it a special treatment. You can all assume what happened. It s not only the money I spent buying that, but also that there is no chance to find this in my country. I understood there is no respect for our valuables !!! I look at it depressed. Nobody will compensate me because they gave me a tiny little sticker to sign on ... In Athens they told me that this tiny paper denies any right of getting money. I hope that you all will be more careful at your check in and if somebody guarantees you safety for your objects, don't trust them !!!!! Just try to find another way.

Title: UNRELIABLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
Content: I bought 4 tickets for my parents, my sister and her baby to travel from Trivandrum to Melbourne, using my credit card. As per their direction, i had been to the Singapore airlines service desk with my credit card, drivers licence and the copy of the tickets, for credit card verification, on 15th of Aug, 2015. Some one at the service desk (singapore airlines, Melbourne airport)helped me fill in an application form , took my credit card number and drivers licence number after sighting it, and got me sign in that form and said, "its all being done". Good that we contacted the airline office at Trivandrum on 24/08/2015, to check everything is well before their flight (they are elderly, and my sister is travelling for the first time, and she has an infant). They now say that credit card verification is pending and they cannot travel unless i myself again go to that office with those documents again to get it verified, AGAIN! My family is supposed to travel tomorrow( 25/08/2015).  What an embarrassing situation it would have been to me if they were told that their daughter (credit card holder) did not do the right thing for their travel, after inviting them here! They would have been in trouble at the airport, not being able to travel as planned!  This Singapore airlines is also causing inconvenience to me by asking me go to their office again tomorrow to get it all fixed before they can travel. I wonder if that form that i completed last week is still lying there somewhere at their desk/ already in the bin. I don't know whether it is what they mean when they say " all been done". UNRELIABLE! I must not forget to say that the lady whom i spoke to this evening over phone( customer service) was trying be very helpful. However, she couldn't do much only because of the careless act of the other person who verified my credit card last week, i believe

Title: Fading its good service
Content: I admitted that the service of Singapore Airline is a lot fading away from long pass 1-2 years ago. I don't know why. Usually, they act fast and provide the passenger the best solution with good explanation and consideration. I experience just couple days ago. I missed my baggage. It is sure a long flight and 2 times transit I admitted. The first itinerary was from Surabaya to Singapore then Dubai by SQ and connected to FlyDubai from Dubai to Muscat. The SQ counter at Surabaya confirmed that they could manage baggage with FlyDubai. It was smoothly done. But, when I flee back from Muscat to Dubai by FlyDubai FZ038 on 31stJul2015 and connected to SQ495 same day, FlyDubai also confirmed that my baggage could be managed until last destination, Surabaya. At Dubai, when I checked in to get my boarding pass, I informed the lady at Transfer Desk B my baggage tag, and she said confirmed until Surabaya. Then upon arriving at Surabaya, I couldn't find my baggage and there was no any notification at all. Until the last bag came out, I could not find it. I checked with lost and found, they helped to recheck all the baggage there, but couldn't find and filed a report. They said tomorrow morning after SQ land, I will get the information. But on tomorrow morning, I did not get any information and I had to call to ask, which said wait until afternoon. In the afternoon, i was called and informed that my baggage was left over at Dubai with unknown reason! They will try to arrange back. So, who has bad service? Why there is no notification to the passenger? After day 3 only the bag is delivered and but it was delivered to me on almost at midnight time 23:30, they woke me up. They rang the door bell, they called to my mobile, then home phone just to wake me up and pick up the baggage. I think it is crazy, the driver said it is an order has to be delivered today.

Title: I can't fault the service.
Content: Economy on long flights is a trial but Singapore Airlines pleasant , efficient, helpful crew try to make it as pleasant as possible. Seat space appears better than on many airlines and seats are reasonably comfortable with provided pillows and blankets. Hot towels provided several times during the flights are comforting and refreshing. Entertainment options are extensive and provide good distraction for those who can not sleep in a sitting up position - even with some recline. Food is adequate, fresh and tasty with a range of snacks available in between meals on extra long flights ( Singapore to Europe). Drink options are plentiful and crew circulate frequently during the flights with trays of juice or water. Singapore Airlines provides good value and a better than average option when flying long haul flights to Europe. Would recommend them over many other airlines on the same or similar routes.

Title: no complaints
Content: Excellent service, not one complaint. We flew business class. Melbourne Singapore, Singapore London. Cabin crew anticipate your every need. Would certainly fly with them again. Best businesses class we have ever experienced.

Title: Very disappointed even as a Singaporean
Content: Being a Singaporean living overseas, I traveled back home very often. However, the service from the airline is getting worst. I am not even proud to say Singapore airlines is top class anymore. I have a young baby and I specifically asked for seats and meals for my baby around 2 weeks before flight. I rang up the reservation line and spoke to the person, everything was good and trying to do the right thing. When I arrived at the airport, nothing was done and it was as if I did not make any reservation at all. This has happened to me 3 times on 3 different flights. I will not fly with Singapore airlines if there is another direct flight from another airlines. I have no choice as it is much easier with direct flight when travelling with young child. I will suggest people with children or need assistance to consider other airlines than Singapore airlines as they are not as helpful as what they used to be and boast to be. I hope the management are reading these reviews and make improvement on it. I still hope to be confident with your services and looking forward to travel with Singapore airlines whenever I come home.

Title: Most horrible flight experience ever
Content: I come to Singapore Airline for it's reputation of luxury. Yep, it's great during flight, but not if you got kicked out of the cabin. I took flights from London to Singapore, then to Sydney. In London, the ground crew claimed he can check in all the flights for me once and selecting seats as well. We accepted, Why not? Nightmare begins, Singapore counter said the check in is not confirmed, (we heard of some computer glitch, but fixed). Then they issue us with the unwanted middle seats. They even threaten me for won't go back to Australia for the next 2 weeks if we don't accept the boarding pass. Alright, let's discuss with the flight attendants and gate officer. Now they gave us the "Best Customer Service EVER".  Gate officer told me to get out of the plane and arrange my next flight. Easy? They close the door immediately when I'm out. What is going on? Now the gate officer gone wild saying "I DON'T WANT TO SEE SUCH A TROUBLE PASSENGER DON'T WANT TO BOARD THE PLANE, AT MY GATE!" Now I'm charged with $200 USD for "missing the flight for own reasons". All I have done is following "orders" of the crews. All the crews 'answer is "just email a complaint." I mean seating is such an easy problem to solve. I have never had any problems with Qantas, Cathay, Virgin. Give us upgrades or just find a good pair of seats or even just ask the passengers would like a swap. Dead simple, but Singaporean doesn't have the brain power to think of. Would never consider Singapore and the whole country, despite I have spent over 2000 bucks and this crap country and airline. P.s. Sorry for I can't provide the original boarding pass as evidence as the angry ground crew tore it to pieces. I hope I can record the whole process which is definitely shocking, but that's not possible due to my concern of safety and the possibility of being arrested. Just take Qantas or Cathay.

Title: Good service, old aircraft BNE-SIN
Content: I regularly fly SQ from BNE-SIN then onto Manado or Manila for scuba diving. Very good all around except the old aircraft that are used BNE-SIN. Even though the other aspects of SQ service are good, I will be flying with a different airline for my next holiday to get a newer aircraft. Plus all SQ flights between Singapore and Brisbane and vice-versa are always fully booked. Why not provide a bigger aircraft for this obviously popular route?

Title: Appalling customer service
Content: I am in utter shock at the appalling customer service by this supposedly world class airline. In brief, I had an important work event to attend in Barcelona so I purposely chose Singapore Airines due to their apparent good reputation. Never again. I flew from Melbourne to Barcelona via Singapore, and my baggage never arrived. I understand these things happen. I was given 60 euro after a lot of hassle and sent on my way. I was without any clothes, work documents, toiletries etc but again, I did not directly blame the airline. I was just very unlucky. I had to spend a lot of money, and use valuable time, buying appropriate attire. During this time I could not get through to Singapore Airlines regarding my bag or status of compensation, despite repeated phone calls and messages. I then proceeded to Ireland on holidays for 2 weeks, where my bag turned up 4 days before I left to return to Australia. My issue is that this happened months ago and I have been passed back and forth by Singapore Airlines customer service without any real responses into my claim for compensation. I am not asking for much, just to be reimbursed for expenses as I am entitled to. I cannot get responses from them and am ignored for weeks. I suppose they hope I will just go away. Some advice, if you want reliability and to be able to actually get a response from customer service when things go wrong, do not fly with Singapore Airlines. Worst I have ever experienced and really not worth the time, effort, expense and heartache.

Title: Good airline
Content: I have flown with these guys at least 5 times. Always nice, friendly staff and never a drama. I am sure I will fly with again and again :)

Title: arrogant, unhelpful, appalling
Content: Should've learnt my lesson the first time I flew with this airline to Paris in 2013, the stewardess made a point of waking me at 1:30am for no reason at all, but this time takes the cake. They brought our flight forward a whole day forcing us to book an extra nights accommodation at a huge rate, offered us no alternatives outside of a refund, was lead to believe by SIA staff that we'd be compensated for the extra accommodation or upgraded only to be later told we'd get nothing. The worst customer service ever. No accountability for their actions, will never fly with them again.

Title: Singapore Airliens never answers their phone
Content: I wanted to talk to a real person - I called and waited for HOURS. Despite multiple calls - they never never never never picked up!! ON even one call. This is utterly abysmal customer service. They do not deserve their apparently good ratings they get. I will never book another flight with them, EVER. Done.OVER. Finished, Absolutely appalling. NO service at all.

Title: Never Again
Content: Well, I didn't have to worry about getting food poisoning at my destination as I contracted that on the flight about an hour after breakfast. I was going both ends and the cabin staff really couldn't care less. Oh, they gave me some charcoal pills and asked if I wanted some biscuits. I am going both ends and they think a biscuit will fix it! I really can't fathom how they got their gleaming reputation. The aircraft from Perth was old and run down. Could hardly see the screen and hardly understand the audio. Then about round 5 in the toilets there was no paper, so I quickly went to the next one and again no paper. I popped my head out the door and luckily there was a hostess walking by who eventually replenished the paper. The food is low grade dog food, the service is slow and the planes are old and dirty - never again

Title: My vote for consistent Service
Content: As a frequent traveler I generally choose SQ as my preferred carrier. I find that they provide the most consistent service and nearly always get all the service basic's right. I find SQ staff engage with passengers pleasantly and efficiently throughout the flight and are generally attentive and accommodating. I have flown other carriers including more recently Qantas, Jetstar (Shudder), Emirates, Virgin (my preferred domestic carrier these days), Air France, Scoot, Ryanair, Malaysian and Vietnam Airways and I will grant that most of these also do the basics well enough. Having said that I have had good and not so good with all of the above and have found Qantas very hit and miss over the last few years, which is a shame. I also flew on an Emirates 777 had the hardest seats I think I've ever sat on, thank god it was only 4 hours. I'd still also rank Malaysian as a pretty good airline despite their unfortunate present situation. Not to say SQ are perfect as I've also had hit and misses with Singapore but with SQ its generally very infrequent, so its the consistency that wins out for me. I also find Changi airport is a pleasant hub and the SQ aircraft are clean, appear to be well maintained and cabin staff are usually very good at service delivery throughout. Points are also available for the Velocity program which helps too. My most recent trip was LON to SYD via Changi and the service on both legs was pleasant and attentive for such a long flight. Enjoyed that we also got to experience the economy section on the upper deck of the 380. Its amazing that we can get from one side of the planet to the other these days in less than 24 hours and I think many travelers sort of forget what an feat of organisation it is, for any airline, to safely move so many people to so many distant destinations on a daily basis. Yes mistakes with bags happen, schedules conflict or connections are missed and the tasty vegan meal you ordered, well isn't, but if you expect these things will happen from time to time and prepare a little for it then the pain nearly always goes away :) I guess the secret to long distance and regular (or irregular) travel is to look for consistency but still allow some time for contingencies, always be insured and learn to practice a little patience. Enjoy your travels and I hope this helps a little in your choices...

Title: Great Airline
Content: The airline provides lots of staff both on the ground and when flying. They are efficient when ticketing for your flight and passengers are not let waiting in line too long. Clean plane cabins and food was good. Enjoyed our flights with Singapore Airlines and will book with them again.

Title: One of the few better airlines out !!
Content: I haven't traveled with Singapore for a bit but I had to say whenever I did travel with them, it has been a very good experience. The flights are usually always on time, the food and in flight entertainment has been good. The layover in Singapore, at times can be tiring but Changi airport is absolutely amazing so it makes it worth while.

Title: Singapore Air Does Not Correct It's Mistakes
Content: Please note feedback given to Singapore Air below: Update 6/1/15 I checked with Virgin Australia Airlines (Singapore Air partner who this flight was originally booked with) yesterday and was told there were multiple flights out of Sydney with open seats for the dates I requested. Clearly Singapore Air was less than honest with me again, I have been told by your staff over and over again that there were no flights. Because there aren't many seats left, I am running out of time to get my trip back on track, and you haven't replied in 48 hours I will be booking my own Virgin flight out of Sydney and will be expecting Singapore Air to cover it's $500 cost as well as refund my $150 excess baggage fee for the bag you misplaced IF I don't receive a reply from you in the next 2 hours. To Whom It May Concern: This is in reference to booking confirmation #: 5XM77U My experience with Singapore Airlines has been absolutely awful this trip, your airline has gone downhill since the last time I used it 7 years ago. During the first leg of my trip I have experienced very unprofessional business practices, dishonesty, and poor customer service. Singapore has destroyed the first leg of my trip in Australia. Here are the issues I've encountered thus far:   Due to poor and unprofessional check in procedures at SFO I nearly missed my flight. I was told that they could not charge my credit card for excess baggage fees at the check in counter due to a system change and that they would have to run my credit card upstairs. After 30 minutes I expressed concern about the delay and it potentially causing me to miss my flight and I was told they were almost done, another 15 minutes lapsed. I expressed concern again and requested my credit card back, they refused to return my credit card and claimed that my boarding pass could not be issued until my credit card was charged. Shortly after I was informed that everything was complete, my boarding pass was stamped priority, and I was promised access to the Singapore Air lounge to get some quick drinks and food because the delays made it impossible for me to purchase some before my flight. When I went to the location where I was told the Singapore Air lounge existed, there was no lounge. I know I was in the right place because I was told it was near the boarding gate. When I asked merchants in the area I was told there was no Singapore Air lounge in the vicinity. Aside from causing me to nearly miss my flight, it is extremely strange, unprofessional, unreasonable, and makes me very uncomfortable that somebody disappears with my credit card for over 45 minutes. I have this well documented, if there are inappropriate charges on my card Singapore Air will be held accountable. So due to disorganization, poor process, and unprofessional business practices I almost missed my flight, my credit card may have been misused, and I was lied to about the lounge. In addition to wasting inordinate amounts of my vacation time to get this straightened out here are the issues I've encountered thus far:   Part of my baggage was transferred from Singapore to Munich, Germany rather than Sydney, Australia (baggage claim ref#SYOSQ35806). Then to make matters worse they failed to deliver the bags to my address in Australia on the night of May 27 as promised. As a result I had to cancel a trip down the coast with 4 of my Australian friends who all had taken time off from work. And it ruined my travel plans to Melbourne Australia.   Yesterday, May 29th I spent 4 hours on the phone with your Sydney reservations team trying to change my booking to fly out of Sydney on an earlier date rather than Melbourne on June 7 as per my itinerary. The first 2 hours I dealt with people whom I could barely understand and who clearly didnt know how to do their jobs, they couldnt locate my flight based on any of the information I had available. Finally I got through to somebody who located my flight but was informed that there were no available flights out of Sydney and they were not authorized to upgrade my class or do anything else to secure me a flight out of Sydney. I was given multiple numbers to call to get this resolved and all of them claimed that they had no authorization   Today, May 30th I call the Sydney reservations team and get the same story but was givcn an email address to escalate this issue but told that the escalation team was not working until Monday. Had I been told yesterday, May 29th how to escalate this I could have sent an email mid day and potentially resolved it same day. Now I am being told I can book and pay for a flight to Melbourne to catch my originally booked flight. Because my travel plans to Melbourne were destroyed I no longer need to be in Australia after my friends wedding today and will incur additional expenses to stay, does it make sense to you that I have to incur additional expense due to a mistake by Singapore Airlines? At this point, I am expecting Singapore Airlines to get me to Denpasar, Bali Indonesia as soon as possible and/or cover the expenses I incur for spending additional time in Australia when I no longer need to. It is also inexcuseable that a customer would have to deal with such a beauracuracy trying to get an issue resolved. If this does not get resolved quickly and/or it still wastes inordinate amounts of my time I can assure you that my wife and I will NEVER do business with Singapore Air again, and we fly USA to Indonesia twice per year, and we will make sure that all of our friends and family who fly frequently dont use Singapore Air. I will also post my experience online so that word gets out about it and will be seeking compensation in court when I return to the USA. At this point its up to you how this ends, act quickly and find an acceptable, fair, and reasonable solution for the situation and I can let it go. Dont take responsibility for resolving the situation quickly and Ive told you what I will do. After my friends goes on his honeymoon today the email address herein will be the only way to reach me.

Title: SIA taking advantage of disabled passengers
Content: I helped my 88 year old mother and blind sister to book 2 seats from Sydney to Penang on 26 April 2015 for SIA SQ232 departing on 3rd of May 2015. Their booking number was 431WBZ Both of them need to sit together as my elderly mother visually guides my blind sister. They then proceeded to look for 2 preferred seats that were side by side. When the cabin layout appeared on the computer screen, there was only one location on the cabin seating plan where there were two seats side by side. The rest of the preferred seats were single seats. They assumed that this was a full flight and paid for these 2 seats that were side by side, 54J and 54H. When they clicked the two seats, there was NO indication / comment on the cabin seating plan itself that these 2 seats were only for able bodied English speaking passengers. I then booked two wheel chairs for them. The SIA officer checked their seat bookings and told me that both of them will be by taken by wheelchairs / mobility aids from the Sydney SIA check in counter to their 54J and 54H seats. He said that everything was in order and that he would generate a request to SIA in Sydney. When they tried to check in at SIA in Sydney, they were told that they cannot have their 54J and 54J seats and that they cannot have a refund of $103, the amount that they paid for these 2 seats. This represents poor customer service by SIA and shows how SIA has exploited two vulnerable passengers. They obviously would not have paid for seats they could not use. My representations to SIA supervisors in Sydney and numerous phone calls to SIA overseas had no effect. Post script When I posted the note above on SIAs Facebook page, SIA sent me the cabin seating plan in a pdf file that appeared on their computer booking screen to argue their case that these two passengers did not read the instructions on the cabin seating plan. (http://www.singaporeair.com/pdf/seatmaps/airbus380.pdf). As you can see from this SIA provided plan, there are no notifications on the seating plan as to who can use them. When the booking was done for these two seats, there were a number of single seats scattered throughout the cabin with the capital letter P attached to them, not just those on the exit points. I mentioned this to SIA and was asked to fill in a customer feedback form, this request comes after having made numerous phone calls overseas and having received a credit refusal email from SIA. How much feedback does SIA want about its customer care towards disabled passengers ?

Title: ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING - 0 stars. OUTRIGHT LIES from them despite proof that they are LYING!
Content: I am absolutely appalled by this third world carrier. No regard for passengers WHATSOEVER, particularly kids. I put in a seating request for a child that gets very airsick well ahead of time. I followed up with phonecalls (over one hour on the phone) to confirm. Was glad when they confirmed it was all sorted. On check-in, the CONFIRMED seat was not available. No window seat was available! My child spent the flight vomiting over and over and over. Thankfully it disrupted the staff too as on the other end I followed-up with Singapore customer service and despite email records AND phone records, Singapore Airlines just LIED and said the conversations never took place. I even had the reference number and the names of the people I spoke to! THEN they cracked a brand new (expensive) suitcase. The main body of the suitcase is cracked as they must have dropped something heavy onto it. Singapore are the most deceitful company I have ever come across as they allege that the main body of the suitcase is a protruding section and therefore they do not cover this damage. The suitcase was new and now is unuseable! It wasn't a protruding section - they couldn't be bothered to look!! NEVER EVER AGAIN! These people are BULLIES and should not be allowed to even operate given their dishonest behaviour. Imagine how bad their aviation safety is when they lie about something as simple as a seat request which is clearly documented. Scary stuff! NEVER EVER AGAIN!!

Title: Worst Customer Service
Content: I called singpore airline customer service for ticket upgrade the Lady put me on hold for 20 mins and they advise me I have call her after 30 mins so she can cancel the check in and then she can upgrde to busniess class. I then call after 45 mins spoke to another lady she put me on hold for another 20 mins and then phone got disconnected. Again I call spoke to anotehr male he told me to call them again after 30 mins so they can make upggrade when I told him I want to speak to his supervisor he told me he will try to upgrade it and now he has put me on hold again. I will never travel in singpore Airlines.

Title: SINGAPORE AIRLINES IS THE BEST AIRLINE WITH EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE
Content: I am writing to you to express my sincerest thanks and appreciation for such an excellent customer service Singapore AIrlines have accorded to myself and my children when we had the problem last December 5, 2014 departing Sydney Airport for Singapore . I am so moved and impressed how you have assisted me and your ground staff to help me check all the options possible within your jurisdiction to resolve the problem. You have made me and my children feel calm and re-assured on the resolution of the situation. I am so thankful for allowing us re-booked our flights in the later date and complete our Journey to Singapore and Philippines. The wonderful Customer Service Officer name Haiyam Murray and Transfer Desk personnel in singapore are : Azman and Ponkothey. Singapore Airlines should be proud of you all for doing your job in the highest standard and making such an excellent impression for Singapore Airlines as a whole. MA. CRISTINA HARNAS

Title: One of the best airline for a long-haul trip, including the transit at Singapore T3
Content: Recently flew with SQ from Sydney to Barcelona, and Paris to Sydney, all via T3 in Singapore. Personally Singapore is a much better transit airport vs. Doha (we flew with Qatar last year). All flawless, no issues, truly enjoyed the Singapore sling on deck. On one of the flight segment, the flight attendant kept coming back and asking if we would like another one (yes, please!). Also, on the first leg, there was a 1-hour delay with a storm in Sydney airport. Ground staff, including manager, and flight attendant came around and offered all passengers a drink (water & OJ).
