They do try to make the best out of any unfortunate situation. Not the cheapest, but for me on a long-haul flight to Europe, they will be my #1 choice. Also, somehow i prefer their old economy seats than the new one as it provides marginally more legroom!

Title: Beyond The Call Of Duty
Content: In October, we were planning to head up to Maldives for our honeymoon, but our passports were stolen hours before our intended flight with Singapore Airlines. We couldn't cancel our flight, the reschedule deadline had elapsed and we had no travel insurance. After explaining our situation to Singapore Airlines the next day, they agreed to postpone our trip for up to 12 months. We eventually decided to go in February, even though February rates were much dearer, the airline did not charge us extra. Thank you again Singapore Airlines for looking after us!

Title: What a Bully!
Content: I had my parents come over to Australia from overseas for few weeks. Flight to Australia was flawless however, leaving Australia was just horrible. The check in agent in Brisbane was rude and very inconsiderate. My parents are in their 60s, they have traveled in the past and are not first-time travelers. Despite my mom having a bad knee and my dad possessing a deteriorating ankle, we did not request for special service because they could still walk, we would rather have someone else who really needs the service use it. Prior to their flight, we weighed, checked and re-checked their luggage. I also read the baggage allowance guide in the Singapore Airlines' website (singaporeair.com/en_UK/travel-information/baggage-allowances/) to make sure that their luggage complies with the rules. I checked my parents in online prior to arriving at the airport. My parents were entitled to 30 kgs of luggage each so a total of 60kgs for both (and according to SIA's website, luggage must not exceed 32 kgs each). At the airport, one of my parents' luggage was 31 kgs and the other was 29 kgs, the check in agent told my parents that this was unacceptable eventhough both still weighed 60 kgs in total. She would only accept baggage not exceeding 30 kgs each. She told my parents that they either have to pay 1 kg in excess or transfer the 1 kg to the other bag. My parents ended up transferring the 1 kg to the other bag despite the information on SIA's website that must not exceed 32 kgs NOT 30 kgs). My parents were also both entitled to a carry on luggage (7 kgs in weight) with the sum of length, width and height of each piece not exceeding 115 cm. The check in agent totally picked on my parents because she also disallowed the carry on luggage that my parents were carrying at the time because she thinks it was too big, without even measuring it, I have used the same luggage as carry on (both in international and domestic flights) in the past and never had issues. There were other passengers who had luggage bigger than what my parents had. I measured the luggage and the sum was not even 100 cm. It would even fit an Airbus 320's overhead bin. Lucky that my parents had an extra bag, so they removed all the contents of that carry on luggage and transferred everything in their extra bag. What's more ridiculous is that while waiting for boarding, the same check in agent used the airport's intercom to page my parents to report to wherever she was (after customs and immigration) just to make sure that they got rid of their previous carry on. Now, that's what I call power tripping. Didn't she have anything better to do than to bully my parents? Weren't they busy enough? Remember, these are two old people in their 60s, one with a bad knee and the other with an ankle injury. If you do not want yourself or someone you care about be disrespected and discriminated, do not fly this airline. That being said, I will never, for the life of me, fly this airline, nor will any of my family. I will also encourage friends and family to avoid this airline. There are better airlines out there who would treat you and anyone you care about with respect and as equal. This is blatant discrimination.

Title: The worst experience I've had.
Content: Bought the trip for me and my baby from sydney to simferopol and back with this company, had the worst experience of my life ! Every single plain was delayed for a few hours which caused all my next plains to leave without us plus, waiting in the airports, taking extra plain trips to get where we needed to get, spend extra money for a new tickets, taking extra trips, my Baby was vomiting, crying and tired plus they have lost my luggage and much more happened.. After emailing all that to them with all the details, they say sorry and want to send me a hamper...!!!?? I can not believe that such a big 5 star company with such a good reputation can not take responsibilities for they huge mistakes they have made. I advise to all of you think twice before you choose..

Title: Good on longer routes, avg on short ones
Content: Longer routes(economy cabin)-Good planes, good crew, good selection of in flight entertainment, food does not disappoint. short route flights ( 2 hours) are disappointing planes feel old. But crew still nice and polite. Will definitely be back!!!

Title: Brisbane to Ho chi minh
Content: In the last 3 years i have flown with sia 12 times. The crew have always been professional . The flight attendants have always been curtious and attended to any requests. There was only one flight from Brisbane to singapore where i felt the cabin crew were below expectations .They were still ok but not quite up to par with what i was used to on previous flights. Overall you cant beat this airline.My next flight is in February 2015 and i got this cheaper than l could have with a budget airline taking into account on the budget airline you need to pay for everything over and above the basic seat booking .

Title: DISHONEST AIRLINES WITH NO CARE AND RESPECT FOR ELDERLY PASSENGERS
Content: I booked Singapore Airlines for my parents from New Delhi to Sydney and also asked for Assistance. The ground assistance in staff told them that their flight was delayed so the next connecting flight to Sydney has already left. Their only option is to board the next flight to Bali and then to Sydney. I called Singapore Airlines office and explained them that my father has a medical condition so please try to adjust him to next direct flight to Sydney rather than sending to Bali. The customer service rep put me on a long wait and then came back with an explanation that flight was not delayed as confirmed by staff in Delhi. I then asked him to explain why Ground Assistance staff then told my parents and 2 other old ladies about missing the connecting flight. Also, why were they given a food voucher? He simply disconnected me. I think that Singapore to Sydney flight was fully booked out so they tricked the old passengers by lying to them and letting them take alternate longer routes. Upon reaching Bali, the Ground staff asked my parents to apply for a VISA. Thank God I gave my father a roaming SIM. I had to spend so much time to explain them that they are not going out but flying to Sydney. The staff had no clue why they even arrived in BALI. What a SHAMEFUL ACT FROM SINGAPORE AIRLINES. EPIC FAIL...

Title: Excellent Service and Friendly Staff
Content: I travelled by Singapore Airline for many times, especially when i was pregnant, or travelling with my kids. They provide with considerate serives for mum and kids. They usually take care of my baby when i was in the bathroom, They reheat my meal cause i was feeding my baby at eating time. Unfortunately, the price is too expensive for a big family with 3 kids to afford, we had to change to other airlines, but never Quantas which treat different passengers in different way!

Title: One of the best airlines - Singapore Air!!!
Content: I've been flying with Singapore Airlines since 2007 (SYD-SIN-MNL). I can't find any faults with this airline. The seats were comfortable and spacious specially on the SYD-SIN flight they use A380 which has a huge monitor with a wide range of entertainment choices from games, music, documentary, tv shows, movies and international films. The service is great with unlimited drinks - coffee, tea, juice, soda, cocktails, wine and spirits. Food is also tasty and satisfying. Upon arriving in Changi Airport, the aiport itself is very huge and clean, there were a lot of activities to do which makes the lay over not so boring, there's a wide range of shopping areas/duty free, garden, pond, butterfly garden, entertainment, restaurants and lounges. On December 07, 2013 me and my friend were upgraded to Business Class seats due to the airline being fully booked. Since we were a KrisFlyer Member they gave us the best seats on the SIN-MNL bound flight. It was an amazing experience (it was our first time on a business class seats!) The food is even better served on a 3 course meal, senior flight steward/stewardess were assisting the passengers on the business class and were very attentive of our needs. Upon take-off we can't even hear the planes engine roaring or can't even feel the plane ascending. Overall Singapore Airlines is one of the best airlines!

Title: Singapore Airlines... If you have the chance, go Qatar or even Qantas
Content: Please, first, allow me to establish a baseline to be fair: I traveled long distances, over 10 hours trips, and through Business class on all companies I will mention about here. I will start from the most important message, based on my experience and opinion, if you can, avoid Singapore Airlines Business. There are a plenty of other companies willing to give you more by the same price. 1st - the airplanes are old, pretty old (all of them). I got 4 different Singapore flights before to publish this. 2nd - Believe or not but not all Singapore Business seats completely recline (180 degrees). 3rd - The cabin crew is not really polite and attentive. 4th - the food options are minimum. I never thought, before Singapore experiences, that I would leave a business class flight with severe Back Pain and hungry. Yes, Hungry - there were only 3 options of food at Business and for my lucky, I didn't like any of them. To me, comparing orange with oranges, Qatar is currently the Best Air Company in the World. I could expend lines and lines writing about the amazing brand new airplanes, immaculate on board service and food. Qantas was not bad too. I would recommend, based on my experience, Qatar (1st), Qantas (2nd) and Singapore (if you really do not have other option).

Title: Not as good as they used to be
Content: Flying from Sydney to London was not as good as we had experienced a few years ago. We had expected that as we had booked two seats for the kids that they would automatically provide us with kids meals. But no, got adult meals instead. There was not enough appropriate kids shows and the food was average. The cabin crew were not as attentive as last time, maybe as the flight was full. On the positive side, its the shortest travel time between Sydney and London. Was given a privilege pass at Sydney which was great for the kids not queuing up for too long. The planes were all reasonably clean.

Title: SIA stewardess are definitely overrated!!!
Content: I normally take china airlines for my monthly flight from Surabaya to Singapore but decided to give it a try n choose SIA as most people referred them as a quality airlines. I found that the departure time is nice but the return time is way too early in the morning so my travel agent adviced me to use SIA sister company, Silk Air for the return. Expecting something special as im paying more money, i didnt find anything special except the extra amenities. The so called Singapore Ladies/stewardess that are heavily advertised on Media are nothing special. I would fare them as overrated so dont be fooled by the apperance from the advertisements, how cute n caring they are. Overall, i wouldnt suggest to everyone who think they pay more n likely to get more, dont bet all your money . Please prepare to be disappointed.

Title: Economy seats like sitting on a board!
Content: Recently my 17 yr old and I took a trip from Sydney to Singapore on Singapore Airlines. Without a doubt the hardest seats we've ever sat on. They have revamped the business class seating but the economy seats are awful. We were both actually hurting by the time we got off the plane and felt bruised all day!

Title: Just about perfect
Content: Flew Melbourne - Saigon via Singapore and back with Singapore Air. All four flights departed and arrived within 10 minutes of schedule, the cabin crew couldn't have been any better, the food was better than standard airline fare and more plentiful, luggage was handled perfectly and the airport staff were ruthlessly efficient while at the same time friendly and courteous. A very positive experience, full marks to the company.

Title: Worst Customer Service
Content: My friend left his laptop at Sydney Airport in December. He rang Singapore immediately and informed them. 2 months later they found it and sent him an email which he forwarded to me to pick up. I rang Singapore's handling Agent Toll Dnata on several occasions and left messages and emails which they never returned. A week later when they answered the phone I gave them the details and they said they had it and to come pick it up. I went to international airport on the same day and after half an hour they could not find it but the manager took my name and number and told me he would call me back later that day. Never heard from him again. Three days later on a Monday I emailed both Singapore Airlines and Toll Dnata explaining my situation. Singapore rang me a few hours later and gave me a ridiculous excuse that the laptop had been sitting for too many months. Wrong, I have their first email sent to my friend and that was end of February. The lady told me her supervisor only had the key to the cabinet and when she is in tomorrow she will call me. The next day she rang me to pick it up and told me to bring the emails with me. and I went. Upon arrival I had to show my licence and also forwarded the emails form my friend requesting me to pick up and original Singapore emails to the lady at Sydney International Airport Singapore Offices on Level 3. After all that she then told me that she would not release the laptop to me because I do not have a printed authorisation paper. I emailed Singapore through their website complaining about this runaround and continual misinformation provided by Singapore which has caused me to take 2 days off work at financial loss to myself and then pay for parking at the airport only to get no where by following exactly what Singapore told me. I still have not heard anything back from Singapore and it has been almost a week.

Title: Would have been perfect if cabin crew weren't tired
Content: I travelled from Hong Kong to Singapore on SQ865 on 3 February 2014. Cabin crew was tired, grumpy after their turn-around trip from Singapore to Hong Kong. Cabin crew was reluctant to give me a glass of water after asking for one. Never mind that, I think pervasive racism occurred. As most passengers were from Hong Kong, I notice the lack of smiles and good will that is usually Singapore Airlines. Most cabin members were rather brusque! My connecting flight from Singapore to Perth (SQ 225) on the same night was what Singapore Airlines has always been - simply, a great way to fly. Cabin crew were friendly, willing to help. During that red-eye flight a thoughtful cabin member used his mobile phone to shine on the drinks tray in a darken cabin interior. I thought it was simply marvellous how such simple things make flying a joy.

Title: Excllent service, food, entertaimment
Content: Flew Bris-Singapore/return with this airline in Jan 14 and they were fantastic. Its a shame a Aussie airlines (VA) were not as classy as this airline. Virgin Australia are an embarrassment compared to Singapore Airlines. Flight Crew unbelievable, Food excellent, Aircraft great, great service, friendly, welcoming, accommodating your needs, nothing a problem. Highly recommend.

Title: Always excellent
Content: Comfortable, decent food and great service. Nothing is ever too much trouble. The staff take enormous pride in their work and are brilliant when it comes to managing difficult passengers. It's my airline of choice: Qantas, British Airways and Luftansa could learn a few things from these guys. Great on-board entertainment. In all, pricey but still good value for money.

Title: Rip Off Australian Travellers
Content: I suppose my biggest gripe with Singapore Airlines is the way that the same return flight PER-SIN-PER costs double what you pay if you book it from their end SIN-PER-SIN. To get around this we booked only the first flight that way, with return in a year, then booked all our intervening flights as ex-Singapore. If you don't fly for a while they cancel your frequent flyer and all your points simply disappear. Food in Business Class is ok, economy class was pretty bad. Business Class lounges in Singapore are not so great if you don't like Singaporean cuisine. Airline is VERY "Singaporean." You are expected to do what you're told, when they tell you, and not object or create exceptions.

Title: Constant Scheduling and flight problems
Content: Not sure what is going on. All my flights with SIA (4 of them) have had to have schedule changes. One waiting 2 hours in Singapore, another in Australia cancelled at the time it was supposed to take off, leaving 200 or so passengers wondering how to get transfers etc. This was once a great airline it now seems to be struggling to run a fleet

Title: Well Done Singapore Airlines
Content: My 60yo mother was travelling between Brisbane and Bangalore last October due to a family emergency. She was intimidated by the fact that there was a stopover at the huge and crowded Changi International airport for 4.5hrs before she had her next leg of flight. We were worried for her till she reached Singapore but on reaching advised that the SA staff were so caring and attentive to her needs that they had organized ground staff to transfer her to the next gate for the next flight to Bangalore on arrival at Changi. This was done despite us not booking a wheelchair assistance. Prior to that the ground staff at the Brisbane International Airport were very kind & generous in their allowances. Do not want to expand too much on that!! Thank you so much Singapore Airlines for making my mother's journey safe and comfortable!! :-)

Title: Excellent Service
Content: Myself and my wife always travel with Singapore Airlines. We feel safe in the knowledge that the service is always excellent and the quality of the aircraft are very well maintained and the air crew are very professional.Meals are excellent and on board entertainment is enjoyable. Seat width is much better than other airlines.

Title: Comfortable flight to Asia
Content: I traveled to Singapore last year with my husband and had a straight forward and comfortable flight. I found there was adequate entertainment, the food wasn't the best, but it was Asian themed and it is plane food. Transfers were straightforward and our bags were at out destination without issues. Flew in June 13.

Title: Quite disappointing
Content: I went on Singapore Airlines last year and the experience was totally horrible! During the time of check-in, we had a problem with the number of baggage allowed in and they told us that we can only have 1 bag each on the plane but the kg can be the same. After a long argument with the manager, they didn't give in to us and therefore we had to take some stuff. On the plane, they were so stingy with the drinks and only gave us half a cup of coke or juice when we asked them! The food wasn't very nice either, it was all soggy and mushy. I also got a stomach pain a few days when i came back from my holiday. What a horrible experience that is!

Title: Great service, price, aircraft
Content: I have flown several times with Singapore airlines, and have never been disappointed, great service, aircraft, lounge rooms, experienced pilots, great outfits for the air hostess that look professional. I would recommend them to anyone wishing to fly somewhere, they have many destinations to choose from at great prices, worlds best !!)

Title: Best experience
Content: When it comes to ultimate professionalism and value, nothing beats Singapore Airlines, although I've heard that Emirates is probably better. Entertainment is personalized on long haul routes and service during flights is next to none. If for no other reason to fly with Singapore Airlines, Changi Airport is a great experience all by itself and an exciting stopover.

Title: Best airline to fly with
Content: Had to write this because I am so happy about Singapore airlines. The service was amazing and did not have to wait for anything. But most of all the honesty. I left my phone and wallet on the plane and I get a call this morning, one of the cleaners have handed it in with all my money still there. Thanks to that cleaner you are a life saver. I would recommend Singapore airlines to any body.

Title: Worse flight I have ever had!
Content: We were about to take off and then got told a passenger was getting off so after a 2 hour wait and no offer of a drink or being able to use the entertainment screen, we finally took off! Our trip to Singapore the week before was great, All the flight crew were professional and lovely and service was excellent! .However this trip home started bad and continued, service from the staff was zero I had to ask for a drink after 3.5 hrs, we were bypassed when the meals were being served and a very rude hostess didn't care when we questioned this. A male staff member realised the situation and was professional and tried to make amends for the rude girl, even telling her so! It was freezing cold and uncomfortable, the staff was so inexperienced and rude and could not cope with the large amount of passengers, toilets were inadequate in numbers as there was a constant line up for 9 hours. They also did not have enough meals for passengers! I will never fly Singapore again...back to thai airlines they are fantastic!!

Title: Not up to high expectations
Content: Flew Singapore to Perth after a flight in which their associated airline SilkAir mislaid two of our bags after a simple short haul flight Koh Samui to Changi airport, Singapore. Plane was on the old side and our entertainment systems didn't work. Service was ok, but I had much higher expecations after hearing from friends about how good the airline was. Arriving at Perth to find one of the wheels on our new luggage damaged beyond repair. Will stay with Qantas, Emirates or similar from now on.

Title: Extremely helpfull.
Content: 6 weeks ago (around May 2) my mother and sister were travelling to Japan. On the day of travel we found that my mothers' passport had expired by some months and we set about getting an urgent replacement. My sister was at Tullamarine awaiting whether mums passport would come through in time which unfortunately it didn't. Singapore Airlines' Tullamarine staff however were extremely helpful in re-booking onto the next available flight, no fuss and no additional cost. This was most welcome given the agitated and uncertain state my mother and sister were in. Thankyou to your staff and organisation again - please pass on my gratitude.

Title: Appalling service and will look for another airline!
Content: Just came back from an excellent Asian holiday that was ruined by appalling customer service from Singapore Airlines. They have an option called the 'Prefered Seating Option' to allow passangers to choose their desired seat at an additional fee. I was taken aback at the fact that they make you pay to choose your seat when other asian carriers don't charge a cent to pick your seat during check in! It was like some budget airline! I had no choice as I had read many reviews regarding the poor seats on this airline so I paid and booked an aisle seat using their shocking website. On the day of departure, I went to check in and was given my ticket by some rude and tired ground staff. The seat on the ticket didn't correlate to the seat I had booked. I was dumped in a seat right up on the window towards the end of the plane. I approached the staff very nicely about this issue but they gave me a sigh and told me I should have checked in earlier then they could have sorted this out! Unbelievable! Yes I had arrived at the airport a little later than I normally do as I had paid for the seat that I wanted so there was no need for me to rush! The staff made this issue my problem when their system is a total mess! They didn't bother listening and I ended up on some of the most uncomfortable flights I have experienced in my years of flying. Why call it the "prefered seating option" if they won't even deliver it? Just another way of scamming passengers... I recommend against this airline and their so called "Prefered Seating" option and if you are going to use it, then be very careful about it as you will lose money!

Title: Customer service varies
Content: I have been using Singapore airlines for a while for my international travels. Not had any major problems as yet. Reason I gave only 4 stars is because of the customer service. Generally it is excellent. But, sometimes really hard to contact them on phone etc. I have found they are not really helpful over phone. Don't really seem to care. On board, they provide good service though. Can be expensive. Overall good experience. Would recommend to a friend.

Title: Non existent customer service
Content: We booked a flight to India to pick up our baby daughter, she was booked on the plane but no eticket was issued. We tried contacting offices in Dehli and Singapore and were told different stories of requirements and using the central customer service number is impossible. My girlfriend gave up waiting on hold twice and it took me 40 minutes before anyone answered to only be told they couldn't help me. I finaly found a helpful member of staff when I landed at Melbourne airport to purchase her a whole new ticket

Title: Perfect for me
Content: I always fly with Singapore Airlines.i fly with them 3 times a year . Other members of my family use the same Airline . Their Planes are good . I like their A380 very much. Their service excellent. Food v good . I have no complaints . I can only say good for Singapore Airlines . Only Singapore Airlines for me.

Title: Never fly with Singapore airlines with KIDS!
Content: Hi I traveled with my family (my wife, 7yr and 11months), Before my travel date, I called Singapore airlines few times to confirm my seats are bassinet seat for the kid from Melbourne -> Singapore. The agent told me everything confirmed and even given me seat numbers.  When I went to airport on travel day i got a shock!. My tickets are NOT bassinet seats and it's regular seats. After speaking with entire Singapore airlines staff (I was keep on pointing to different person!!) I got a bassinet seat for only me. My son was sitting in different place. After landed in Singapore I again complaint about it and confirmed my return ticket. She said everything fine. Again while coming I had same shock!! this time there NO bassinet seat and our entire family was sitting in regular seat. Most horrible experience I ever had in my 15years of my travel. After coming back I sent a email to Singapore airlines and got a following funny reply "I would like to share that our investigations show that a technical glitch had been present in our Reservations system. On this occasion, while passengers were able to select the seat at the point of booking, the glitch allowed for other passengers to select bassinet points as well even though they had been taken up. As such, the bassinet seat was on a pending basis and had not been confirmed eventually. I understand that you had approached our ground staff in Singapore for their assistance in confirming your bassinet seat requests. I note that our staff had affirmed that the bassinet seats were confirmed. However, your return flight on SQ217, the seat was on a pending basis as well. Furthermore, please be assured that our IT department is aware of the glitch and they are working closely with our vendors to rectify the defect. As a gesture of our goodwill for the disappointment caused on this occasion, I would like to present you and your family with a transportation voucher for AUD100 each." Since I am not planning to travel again in near future I requested to send the voucher as check/cheque. I more than 10 emails no reply from anyone from Singapore airlines.

Title: Very impressed with the cabin service and the A380.
Content: We had a family trip to India via Singapore with 7 flight sectors in April 2013. The service from Singapore Airlines was excellent. I am surprised by some of the preceding trivial complaints; people forget that the main purpose of the cabin crew is to ensure the safety of those onboard they are not waiters and waitresses although they do this very well also. I noted that the cabin crew were very particular with checking seat belts, baggage on the floor, window shades and seat backs. The A380 was impressive and surprisingly quiet. The seat pitch was as good as any other economy seat on other airlines. The 777 was a bit noisier but no more so than other airlines 777s. The food was great and we found tasty choices on each sector. The entertainment system was great with a huge choice of movies, TV, games, flight watch etc. Our kids were very well looked after with small size headsets and free gifts with games and colouring in pencils. We were very lucky to have smooth flights even with thunderstorms and lightning visible at times. No wonder they are rated the #3 Airline in the world 2012.

Title: Good airline - Old Aircrafts
Content: I had a family trip to India via Singapore with a 4 year old daughter and 1 year old twin boys recently in Feb 2013. I find the service good and they looked after us really well. I had booked the tickets through an agent however I had no issues confirming bassienet seats online for all the travel legs. Onboard the flight attendants catered well. We had pre-requested meals so the food was good and edible. They also provided milk for boys when at one instance they refused to drink formula. Ground staff at Sydney was very help too. The only problem is that their aircrafts are really old, seats uncomfortable and entertainment unites sometmes do not work. Their aircraft is very untidy too and especially the remote control seems like it was never wiped once installed. During turbulance the aircraft rattled very badly on the inside that i once felt it is literally going to split open. I would have rated this review good if their aircrafts were much cleaner and seats more comfortable

Title: Bullied by Singapore Airline Ground Staff
Content: We were 3 adult passengers and an infant travelling from Bangalore to Brisbane via Singapore. We were carrying with us 3 pieces of handbags and an extra bag with infants food, filtered & bolied water as the infant had issues with water in her Singapore Airlines flights earlier in the month which made her sick for a week, change of clothes her napkins etc.. So, in total, we had 4 bags for the 4 passengers. We passed the security without any problems but were stopped and advised by one of SIA ground staff (Mr. [name removed] is what he was referred to by the other staff) that we could not take the extra bag for the infant and we could carry only 2 pieces of hand luggage on the flight as cabin luggage for the 4 passengers. The infant handbag consisting all the infant's meals and other requirements needed to be checked-in as also will my handbag as they do not allow infant any hand baggage allowance. The ground staff hurried us up and was tagging the 2 baggages to be sent along with the check-in luggages while I was still protesting. It was only upon my mother's repeated pleading to the staff that they considered letting the infant's bag in. The flight wasnt even full and had many seats vacant so space wasnt the issue. We have requested SIA for an explanation of this behaviour by their ground staff but havent received any response from them. International Airlines like SIA can have their way these days as there are no channels to escalate these issues to in most countries including Australia. I have been flying SIA for the last 13 years and will now consider other airlines and so will my family and friends.

Title: Great friendly staff, hassle free check in
Content: Great staff who are very friendly and helpful. Have flown the last 5 - 6 times and everytime it has been a great experience. Kicking myself for going with Emirates this last time and getting nothing but trouble. I recommend them to all my friends and family and no complaints so far.

Title: Unfriendly Staff,Old aircrafts
Content: The staff don't pay attention to your needs, had to ask for a glass of water 3 times before I got one. Also aircrafts are like decades old and feels like they may break in pieces. certainly won't recommend to anyone, there was a stopover at Colombo airpart so took two flights, both planes felt like they were going to fall apart,

Title: Worst long-haul flight ever
Content: Flew from Singapore to Frankfurt on board an absolutely ancient Boeing 777 which was not just old (that I can cope with) but which was filthy dirty. The carpets are shabby, there are dirty marks everywhere and it just feelsl ike it hasn't been cleaned for years. For a 13-hour flight this makes you wonder if it is so terrible on the surface, what the quality is like of the aircraft below the surface. We had terrible turbulence across India, the Stans and, in fact, for around 8 hours of the 13-hour flight. Yet, it felt like the plane was flying on autopilot with the pilots asleep as they did not give us any information the whole flight - not about the route, the weather, why it was so bumpy, and they certainly didn't try to shift altitude (we were just at 9,700 meters) during the turbulence to make it more comfortable for passengers. To make matters worse, the crew are absolutely unfriendly with very poor English. I had a sick stomach and needed something to settle it - as I was vomiting for half of hte flight ... all they could offer me was water with lemon, hot chocolate or Rennie's, nothing else ... even the water came back up. During the worst of the turbulence, I felt like the plane was going to break in half - such an old vintage machine should not be allowed to fly such long flights. All in all, I would never fly with Singapore Airlines again - they are completely overrated regarding their service and standards. I did not feel safe or comfortable the entire flight and just wanted to get off the plane. Better to fly with Lufthansa's new and professional crew on the A380 on this route. Just watch though as they can codeshare sometimes with Singapore Airlines and I wouldn't wish this flight with SIA on anyone else. To top it all off, the crew dance around in Asian style flowery costumes but they are so unfriendly compared to other Asian airlines and their English is horrific. They keep coming around with hot towels etc but I'd prefer less time spent on these stupid superficial details and a better aircraft and a more safe and relaxing flight. And to make matters even worse, if you have an 8-hour stopover in Singapore, the business (i.e. Gold class) lounge just sucks ... there is no quiet relax area, the toilet is 200 meters outside the lounge, there are no showers and the food choice is terrible. . Never again!

Title: Booking nightmare
Content: Having booked a flight for our Sales Manager and paid using my Amex card all on line i was happy with the service. I went to do exactly the same thing a week later and was told i would have to take my credit crad to the nearest Singapore Airline office for verification before he would be allowed to fly. When i questioned this i was told that was the way it was. So i said i wanted to cancel the flight and we would book via Emirates. He said it was a non rewfundable airfare and my card would be charged! I said how come you can charge my card when i want to cancel, but you cant use my card to pay for the flight. After 45 minutes on the phone he agreed to let me email him the form with ID. He could have suggested that in 5 minutes and saved us all a lot of time. I have since had another two call to them each nearly half an hour. I have never had these problems with Qantas or Emirates and will give them preference next time.

Title: Children in Business Class
Content: The Crew were fantastic. Unfortunately I had a horror flight from London to Singapore due to a family consisting of two adults and three young children who did not settle down until a couple of hours out of Singapore causing myself and others, in Business Class, sleep deprivation. Children should be excluded from Business Class as passengers pay a lot of money to travel in this fashion, expecting to be able to sleep on the long haul.

Title: Manchester Perth via Munich and Singapore
Content: The outgoing flight had all passengers getting off the plane at Munich with all their hand luggage. This proved very difficult and inconvenient for people with small children. The return journey was hampered at Munich by plane having to be de-iced before take off. After such a long journey this was the last thing we needed. I could not recommend the Manchester to Perth flight with Singapore Airlines.

Title: Got hit by food cart
Content: I had an accident on board. The stewardess hit me with the food cart. I really got hurt. They then gave me an ice pack and then wrote an incident report, gave me a copy, but took it away again. Now say that the accident never happened. I would make it all up and might have hit my knee somewhere else. They say very much that I a a bit stupid. This is unbelievable, I am taking them to court now and then make sure my story goes around. They also told me that I should have been happy that they took me to the hospital (where they identified a clear line and confirmed to be hit by a sharp corner)... if I were not a Westerner, they would do nothing.

Title: Poor Service
Content: Traveled Sydney to London, seats very uncomfortable. Two items on menu for breakfast and they ran out of one before getting to us. Tried to upgrade for return journey & found staff to be unhelpful and uninterested so lost our money to them and flew back with another airline in comfort.

Title: Excellent
Content: I travelled business class to UK in June 2012 with Singapore Airlines, I was travelling alone and having arthritis there were many things the staff assisted me with which I simply could not have managed on my own - assistance with luggage and practical assistance on the plane. They were attentive and bright in both directions. Airport lounges were excellent though at heathrow there was a different lounge being used temporarily due to some maintenance or something, ok but not up to the same standard as the other lounges. Lounge in Singapore provided an excellent selection of food and service - offerings varied according to the time of day. Flight was expensive but it was a last minute booking due to a family emergency. We have booked to fly business class next year 2013 which was quite a bit cheaper booking early. Highly recommend the A380 and the Singapore configuration was very comfortable. Have travelled previously with Singapore Airlines in Economy and the service then was excellent. Would highly recommend both classes of travel with Singapore Airlines but if you can afford business class it is certainly a very enjoyable experience.

Title: Fantastic BUT...
Content: Cheers to Singapore Airlines, my elderly mother and I have just completed a UK to Perth flight and I am so happy with our economy flights both to and from the UK, BUT not the airlines fault but from the start at Heathrow airport three small children screamed non stop to Singapore, then two of the three boarded from Singapore to Perth, even when we were trying to sleep you could hear the screaming, all passengers were deeply affected by this problem, what is the answer, it has turned me off any future long flights, I am a mother of three children and therefore do sympathise, but it was a nightmare that we are still trying to recover from, after a fantastic three weeks the last 22 hours were miserable, I am sure most of the other passengers and staff would also have a comment. Terri.

Title: Accident on Singapore Airlines being wiped under the carpet... be careful !!!
Content: I was on my flight from Brisbane to Singapore when the stewardess hit me with the foodcart, I was sick for about 6 months.... Singapore Airlines gave me an incident report, but then took it back again. Now Singapore Airline is denying the accident... I am taking them to court now. From now on I am flying Korean Air...

Title: Not getting gold status with Star alliance for this year and next year because of Singapore Airline
Content: Singapore website failure and they won't accept their responsability....Book a ''Y'' class for accumlation and get a non accumulating class on their side. Miss your Star Alliance gold status for this year and the Next year....very nice... In September 2011, My mother made a booking for a flight from Singapore to Maldives with Singapore Airline. Before booking her ticket, Mr. xxx (assistant) call to ensure if she wouldve book this ticket, it wouldve been an eligible fare with Singapore Airlines to earn frequent flyers miles. The agent confirmed that this type of ticket wouldve been eligible. The Passenger booked the ticket along with The accompanist. Before paying the ticket, an option offering the passenger to view the reservation by sending an e-mail is offered. On this confirmation, we could see the Y booking class (eligible class for earning miles with Aeroplan and star alliance members). The Passenger then went ahead with the payment for final confirmation of the ticket. The accompanist and The Passenger did receive the ticket by e-mail. The ticket is showing a Y class. The accompanist called Singapore Airlines on the 19th of September as well to confirm that the class showing on the ticket was an eligible fare for miles accumulation. The agent at Singapore Airlines said ''Yes''. The accompanist ensured on both ways during the checking process that Singapore Airline had the Aeroplan number of The Passenger for miles accumulation. The Agent in Singapore as well as the agent in Male, Maldives, confirms that: yes she would get her miles. The Passenger only book this flight with Singapore Airline because she would get her miles in her Aeroplan account. On October 7th 2011, The accompanist Called Aeroplan to confirm they would send a request to Singapore airlines to add the miles because they where not reflecting in The Passengers account.  On October 17th 2011, The accompanist called both Aeroplan and Singapore Airline to make sure the request was handled properly and the points will get in her account. Both companies said they would take care of it. The accompanist also send an e-mail to Singapore Airlines. On October the 21st 2011, Mr. Guillaume The accompanist call Aeroplan. Aeroplan answer him that Singapore Airlines refuse to give the points and they did not understand as it was a Y class. They said they would send a request again because The Passenger should get her miles credited in her account. The accompanist then wrote an e-mail to Singapore Airline again. Singapore responded by saying it was not booked on a Y class. They said that it was a system glitch and it was showing Y class at the time of booking but in their hands, it was not a Y class. He also wrote to Star Alliance about the issue but star alliance said that they are not related to the booking of airline nor miles programs. Singapore denies their responsibilities. Aeroplan said I should call Air Canada because they handle the Program, Air Canada stays unresponsive. After many communication between all parties, there Is no solutions. The Passenger will not achieve her Gold Status Early recognition for this year and neither for next year because she did not get the miles from Singapore Airlines in her Aeroplan Account. Very Sad :( To top the story, they have lost one of the luggage and and the food was very bad. Do not order special meal.

Title: OK
Content: I flew economy to Singapore on one of the older Boeing 747s and its age was starting to show on the interior. The screen wasn't great and the controls were difficult to use. We flew back on a smaller Boeing which was newer and consequently the in-flight entertainment experience was more positive - better screen, better controls. Having done my research, I found the cheapest price on their own website www.singaporeair.com. As I was paying for the ticket however, the website started "experiencing problems" and crashed in the middle of the transaction - I paid for a ticket but wasn't issued with one. Long story short, I had to wait three days for the money to reverse back onto my card and had to use money I allocated for other expenses to get my ticket while I waited for the money to make it back onto my card. Every time I called up their ticketing office, I spoke to a different person and had to repeat my story each time which was very frustrating. I was put on hold several times for lengthy periods. Apart from that, the in-flight experience was relatively pleasant. The staff are attentive to your requests and there were no problems with the flight itself.

Title: Delayed flight
Content: No doubt every every passenger expects a certain level of service when flying but its when something exceptional occurs that a real challenge might occur. I was on a Singapore Airline flight out of Singapore on July 11th to Perth, Western Australia. We were scheduled to depart at about 1.10am and did so soon after. A breakfst was served well into the flight, but our srrival in Perth was delayed by fog. Perth's airport was closed and we were diverted to Learmonth where the aircraft had to refuel. Some hours later we set off again, to arrive in Perth several hours after the scheduled time.  My comment a vote of thanks to the cabin staff for . despite being on their feet doing their best to serve the passengers for all those extra hours, they continued to offer courteous service while maintaning a friendly demeanour. Thanks is tendered. .

Title: Good Customer Service, Professional but expensive
Content: If you have money, use this airline since they have good customer service, food are pretty good and when things go wrong eg. your luggage got sent off to different country, they would at least provide some compensation money until your luggage is recovered (happened to my family once on a tour to Europe).

Title: Excellent
Content: This is a great airline with outstanding service. I fly Singapore Airlines about once a year for business trips to Asia and find them superior to Qantas on the routes I take; not only that, but their fares are often less. Checking in at Brisbane or in Singapore is a breeze. Their food is good and the entertainment system is OK.

Title: Be Afraid, be very afraid
Content: I flew from Sydney to Singapore then on to London. Flew economy because there is no justification for the huge difference in fares. I was greeted at the check in desk by two women, each of whom looked as though they had just crawled out of a bunk somewhere.I had to wait for the yawning to stop before proceeding. On board the interior of the aircraft was filthy and had a pervading stale odour. Seats were furnished with a blanket and small pillow in obviously recycled packaging.I would not line my garbage bin with what they served for food. The previous occupant of my seat had vomited his up and the result had been left on the seat in front of me.If this were the apocalypse, swim to your refuge before flying Singapore Air.

Title: Will definitely not fly with them again until they replace their aircraft
Content: I flew from Brisbane/Singapore/Cairo in May 2012. The Brisbane to Singapore leg was "acceptable" but then the aircraft change from Singapore to Cairo was nothing short of disgusting. How old are these planes??? The return journey from Istanbul to Cairo was once again "acceptable" but then Singapore to Brisbane I wondered whether I could actually make it through the flight without screaming. The aircraft seemed to have been built around the time of the Ark - I had a window seat but the gap between the seat and window, you could not even put a cushion to sleep as it kept falling through. The seats barely reclined, the movies and channels were not even worth watching (who chooses them!!) the blankets looked like they had come straight from a St Vincent De Paul op shop and the cushions weren't even worth having. The food on ALL legs was almost inedible, and I can keep on going. Was so looking forward to my many flights with "airline of the year" but they actually ruined my whole experience. Never again, upgrade your aircraft or lose everyone.

Title: Outstanding !!
Content: We did Brisbane to Amsterdam last year 2 Adults and 2 Young Kids. If you have Children you will love Singapore Air.The service is fantastic The food is terrific & ask for the free Singapore Sling Cocktails which are delicious.They show constant atention to do all they can to keep the kids happy and well fed with treats and snaks etc.The staff are so friendly compared to other airlines. The A380 was a nice clean and comfortable aeroplane but avoid at all costs taking their 777-200 which we liken to a cattle truck,the 777-200 is shocking small and uncomfortable cold and stinky toilets the seats were very hard. We changed our return flights from Switzerland just to avoid it and go on the A380. The A380 is Heaven sent for Economy travellers with children but try for the upstars few seats(best).The food is Totally delicious and the onboard entertainment is excellent. One downside is if you have to Fly to Amsterdam then I recommend you Change airlines at singapore just to avoid the terrible uncomfortable 777 which is all they use on this leg.You can however fly into germany ,france,uk etc on A380 and A330.Just not Holland

Title: The best in my opinion
Content: I've been using Singapore Airlines for years as I travel very frequently from Perth to Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand and Hong Kong on business. Usually I book online on their website but on occasion I have had to call a consultant mainly for advice on multi stopover flights. I notice some complain about SIA being expensive. I've found Cathay Pacific is much more expensive and Qantas is slightly more. There may well be cheaper options but all things considered I think SIA is well worth the cost. Personally I'm happy to pay more for quality and reliability. I am a PPS club member and their club rooms are the best in my opinion. I do fly business class mostly but on short flights like from Singapore to KL I have used economy. I can honestly say I have never had an issue on any flight with Singapore Airlines regardless of ticket class. The service on the ground and in the air is outstanding, they are rarely late departing and when they are its for understandable reasons. Their aircraft are clean, seating is very comfortable, the crew are happy to assist always, food is very good and communication is excellent. The only criticism I have is minor and that is their website has a tendency to go into meltdown if you try to book too many stops on the same trip but its not that big a deal. Fly with SA, you wont regret it.

Title: Business Class & First Class still Best. Economy class standards need massive improvement
Content: I have been travelling 2x/month for the last 8 years and have been priviledged to have travelled on numerous airlines and different classes depending on the travel budget accorded to me. Being both a Elite Gold Krisflyer & PPS member, I can give a genuine first-hand experience of SIA & it's services. Considering the costs of it's business & first class tickets, the services and standards do match up well & above my expectations. Without a doubt, when I do have the choice of airline, i will always choose SIA if I'm allocated the budget / authorised to fly business / first class. However, on numerous times due to last minute flight plans, I've been allocated to travel Economy class. Unfortunately, I will not always choose SIA. Lack of inflight staffing, poor customer service, poor english, smaller seats vs other airlines, dirty toilets are all reasons I am so hesitant, especially on flights longer than 4 hours. I remembered SIA being the TOP & Number 1 airline in the world for many years running. They will achieve that if only they bring their Economy Class up to par.

Title: SIA is rated highly because they get it right.
Content: I have been a Krisflyer member for years and I've booked several dozen flights in SIA's website and not once have I had an issue with not being awarded flyer points. I don't see how any KrisFlyer member who claims to have booked a flight on SIA's website would have a problem because its so straight forward a process. You log onto the site with your membership number and password, search for the flights to the destinations you want, select the preferred flights, confirm and pay for your tickets, how hard can that be? You are provided with a detailed itinerary, which includes the date and time of each flight, your class of ticket, which terminal your flight/s leaves from and the miles you will earn on each flight. You also have the option to select your seat and meal. My point is if a passenger wants to be assured of gaining the flyer points for their trip it makes more sense to book the ticket with the airline directly. Why rely on a third party only to find out you didn't get what you think you're entitled to and then blame SIA for it. Singapore Airlines is my preferred carrier because they are extremely good at what they do and that's what counts for me. Service, reliability, consistency, quality in flight and in their lounges, with flight crews and ground staff that are second to none and that's how they got to be an excellent airline. I would rate an airline on what matters and not on a petty issue like frequent flyer points, an issue that could have been avoided with some common sense.

Title: Good
Content: My experience with SIA has always been wonderful. The staff have always been friendly. We travelled with our 5 mth old baby and she did not sleep much during the 8 hr flight. The staff kept giving us things to entertain her and often stopped by to play with her. On our return flight my husband's TV screen was not working at all and we were given vouchers to use for the onboard dutyfree.

Title: Excellent
Content: We flew from Australia to the UK with a 3 year old and were dreading the trip. However Singapore Airlines couldn't do enough for us. Suppose it makes sense really, if the little kids are happy after then everyone else on the flight gets some peace and quiet.

Title: Excellent
Content: It is 15 years since I flew on Singapore Airlines, but it was the best airline of the many airlines I have flown with by far. It was a long haul flight between UK and Australia and I didn't even feel the Boeing 747 touch down it was so smooth, absolutely outstanding. The hostess and staff were the best presented and most professional of all airlines I have flown with. The food was excellent, the aircraft were immaculate and the entertainment system was awesome.

Title: Excellent
Content: We have flown with a few airlines Emirates, Virgin, Qantas. We would rate Singapore airlines to be the best. The service is very very good, airline staff are always very pleasant. In flight entertainment including tv and games screen in front of each seat was great. Food was really good! I cant believe how much they gave us to eat! They also come up the cheapest when we were flying the first time to London. Unfortunately on our second trip they werent the cheaped so we flew with Virgin. Virgin were not as good. Really should have paid the little extra to fly with Singaport Airlines again. They also stoppped over in Singapore for a night, which made the flight easier. They also have a reward system. Watch out for the release of flights to UK and europe early in the year as these are particularly cheap!

Title: service used to be better
Content: I have been flying SIG for many years and am a Krisflyer member. Once you are at the airport and in the air, the service is excellent. Friendly staff, clean cabins, good meals and the staff go out of their way with little snacks and drinks. However, staff in the Sydney office are terrible. They do not reply to emails, it's impossible to get through to them on the phone and if you do, the service is bad. It's such a difference to their offices in Singapore, New Zealand or Frankfurt. If you can book online and have a straightforward flight without stopovers/add on flights, it's fine, but as soon as you have any of these it becomes a nightmare to deal with them. I even had staff in Singapore commenting that they would complain about the office here.

Title: Substandard business class - Singapore not always the leader
Content: Having booked business class and paid $9,000 for a return flight to Europe from Sydney I was shocked to experience a very old cabin design and a very sub standard business class all the way back to Sydney from Istanbul. I am a frequent international traveller and this was the worst business class I have experinced for a very long time. If you choose to travel with Singapore ensure you check what aircraft your traveling on and cabin lay out. I won't be travelling with Singapore again.

Title: Excellent
Content: We fly to Philippines(Cebu) every few years. We have tried other airlines and spoke to friends that have flown with some others as well but Singapore Airlines is by far superior. There are cheaper options via Manila but that means spending another day or two to get to where we need to go. Traveling on certain days means an hour stop-over at Davo can be eliminated. Although good deals can be had by shopping around travel agents it pays to check the Singapore Airlines website as there are regular specials and one can save more than half the best travel agents price by booking on-line.

Title: Good
Content: I really enjoy flying on Singapore Airlines. I have flown them on numerous flights and all have been great. I have used them also from Melbourne to Singapore and there was a 1 hour delay before the flight started (due to mechanical issues), but believe it or not, we actually reached Singapore at the usual arrival time. I wonder if the pilot took a short cut? The seats are comfortable, there is really great entertainment and the food is tasty too. The seats have an individual monitor and there is so much to watch or games to play, that I have sometimes not slept just to watch a great movie or play a game. Overall, travelling by Singapore Airlines made my journey much more pleasant and enjoyable.

Title: A Great Airline
Content: Majority of my international travels are either by Qantas or Singapore Airlines. But more frequently would be on Singapore Airlines. It is not just the superior service but also the aircraft they are flying are newer. Usually before I book with an airline, I would normally check which aircraft they will be flying to my destination and I would recommend anyone to avoid 747 as it is one of the older aircraft and seats tend to cramp and engine is noisier. When flying with Singapore airlines, I choose to fly either with A380 or 777-300. With Singapore A380, try to go for upper deck seat, as it has 2-4-2 configuration, perfect for couple. It also has extra side compartment for the 2 seater. What I like the most about flying with Singapore Airlines is that, if you book direct from their website and providing you are a Krisflyer member, you can book and choose your seat immediately, even, when your flight is 6 or 8 months away. Unlike Qantas, where you can only select your seat 48 (or 24) hours prior to departure (and must also pay $20 for seat selection?), you have none of that with Singapore Airlines. Another feature that I like (and other airlines starting to have this) is that you can do internet check-in 48 hours prior to departure.

Title: The way flying should be.
Content: Always fly them these days. Just over being stuffed around and ripped off elsewhere. These guys might be a bit more expensive, but it's SO worth the extra. The SIA model demonstrates that people are happy to pay extra for a good service. Qantas and all the others who complain about not being able to compete have got it all back to front. Make the experience as good as it is on SIA and your planes will be full all the time even if your prices are higher.

Title: Recommended while travelling with kids
Content: I travelled with them from Melb to Singapore... (and from Singapore took their alliance Silk airlines to Ktm...)I was travelling alone with a 5month old... and I have nothing but praise for their services... as soon as they saw me carrying a baby in my baby carrier... and dragging my hand luggage.. they instantly offered to carry the hand luggage for me...my baby could not even sit at that time, so i could not just put him on my seat to put my luggage and his diaper bag on the overhead luggage carrier... and they were kind enough to do it for me...when they brought the food.. one of the air hostesses always took my baby.. and sat on the availabe empty seat close to me.. where i can still see my bubz.. and enjoy my lunch... when i had to go to the toilet... again they took care of him for me.. and even let me escape the long queue and use the business class toilet...My family was worried about how i would take that 17 hour in total flight.. but singapore airlines with their super reliable, efficient and friendly staff.. made my journey much easier...On my way back though... they were a bittish less helpful than b4...I had to ask for help... ather than them helping voluntarily.. but they still helped though! so while travelling from melb to Singapore I'll give them 5 stars.. but back to melb... I'd give them 3 stars... ( maybe they thought.. i was juss one of those many migrants who migrate to Aus.. and did not know about airline services and stuffs.. dunno!!!) .. so yeah.. in average 4stars!!!!! I would use them over and over for sure! More so while travelling with kids!

Title: Comfortable seats & pleasant staff
Content: The staff were helpful, the seals were comfortable. The entertainment thingies were great. Huge movie & music selections. Well done! Food was OK.

Title: SQ great way to fly in Asia ex PERTH
Content: SQ is one of my first choices out of Perth for the Asia Pacific travel. PER is lucky to have 4 or so flights each day to SIN so it's a bit like catching a bus with great service. Being a regular, most of the crews are pretty familar with requirements, always friendly. If flying SQ around asia/US/EUR then usually everything goes well without a hitch with minimal interferance on the ground. Cabin Crew and Accomodation is probably second to none, although CX was also pretty good in the 90's and 00's as well. But with the A380 SQ now has the edge. The SQ Terminal is perfect for SQ travellers. (kind silly if you dont travel with them, life is made so easy).. Shopping, day trips to SIN, cinema in house as well as reasonable priced food on the "non-airside".. means you have to enter SIN then reenter. (No big deal and takes only 5 mins at worst)... I always tell immigration, "I am stepping out to have a meal at Burger King it cheaper outside than inside" - Always gets a smile. Plus I am back within 90 minutes.... Back to SQ - Economy Class consistently good. Though I have been annoyed with Business Class at times, simply because I occassionally get bumped at the last minute, due to higher Kris Flyers boarding than me. It an Asian thing, but you are judged on loyalty and milage... Though I fly each fortnight with SQ... Its low miles on the PER-SIN-CGK route so hence I dont build up the points like many regulars. Nevertheless, Business Class and First Upgrades esp A380 are excellent for long haul 10 hr plus travel stints. Thanks again SQ

Title: very child friendly
Content: I have to say with confidence that my experience of SG airlines is that they are one of the most child friendly airlines available out there - I will not hesitate to travel with them again with a new baby!! So thank you SG Air!

Title: It doesnt get any better than that!
Content: We have flown singapore quite afew times now and have always enjoyed it. Excellent customer service, great food, friendly staff, spacious and newer planes (especially A380). They are rated as one of the best for a reason, other companies need to follow suit, their the best and will always be.

Title: Excellent
Content: My recommendation is simply if you can get there via Singapore Airlines...you will not do better. Singapore Airport is worth visiting on its own. It is fast to get around on free aerial trams. There are free movies in comfortable theaters. great massages. Great restaurants. Plenty of duty free shopping.

Title: Great airline
Content: I had a great time flying with Singapore Airlines. The flight attendants were absolutely lovely and made sure we were well looked after. The food was nicer than most airlines, and they had a good choice of current music and in-flight movies. I will definitely fly with them again.

Title: Quality airline
Content: They are more expensive when compared to other airlines. Having said that I always travel in comfort, have better food, excellent entertainment, and have a pleasurable flight on Singapore Airlines. I really enjoy flying with Singapore Airlines. I have flown with them several times and all have been great. The seats are always comfortable, there is really great entertainment and there is a great selection of food too. The staff are also always friendly and helpful. The seats have individual monitors so you can watch or play what you want. Overall, I recommend this airline to everyone as it is always pleasant and enjoyable.

Title: Terrible
Content: Dreadful airline. All the hype about service is just that hype. Back to Thai next time.If you are unlucky enough to have to fly with this airline at all costs avoid the A380 but better still just dont fly with them.

Title: Excellent
Content: I travelled internationally pretty regularly, I've flied via Air China, Qantas, JAL, China Southern airline and Singapore airline. I found Singapore airline is the best among all these airlines I've flied with. I've booked both Business class and Economic class. I've been very satisfied with both service. When my eld parents come to visit me from overseas, I had no hesitate booked them tickets and travelled via Singapore airline. They provided very helpful service when my father missed his domestic flight to Beijing for his international flight to Sydney via Singapore due to the Chinese domestic flight was cancelled. When my father finally arrived Beijing, it's only 30mins before his international flight to Singapore would departure. The staff of Singapore airline in Beijing was so nice, comfort my father and arrange him to rest at the lounge and change his flight to the very next flight to Sydney via Singapore. I can't appreciate enough for what they have done for my father. and will definitely continue choosing the Singapore airline for my family's international travel.

Title: Terrible
Content: I was suprised to see the lack of service on the singapore airlines, Sydney to Singapore route (economy class). Generally flying Qantas this route, i decided to go with SA after seeing some great online reviews; to be heavily let down. Firstly i was .5 of a kg over for checked baggage, and the checkin clerk would not accept the baggage - with Qantas/BA ive been over 6kg over and they never say anything. Secondly the service in the sky was terrible. The food truely tasted like plastic (i am not a fussy eater), and when called for an FA, it took 4 pushes of the button and 20 minutes for them to respond, only to get my request wrong 2 times. The cabin crew after serving meals disapeared to the back of the plane where they seemed to be having a large conversation between themselves (i was sitting near the back). The older lady who was sitting next to me also called for an FA for a cup of tea, though again no-one came. This time after 5 minutes i walked to the back of the plane and asked them myself to make this poor lady a cup of tea. The FA's were clearly not happy and would have prefered to continue there conversation. Thirdly, my baggage got lost after arriving at Singapore. It took 2 days for it to arrive. The funny thing about it was that it was a direct flight - never knew this could happen. Overall SA was a big let down. After seeing good reviews i thought that they would be a really good airline. I could not notice any difference between seat comfort and legroom compared to other airlines flying this route, and due to the events which occured, i would consider this to be discraceful and an embarrasement to SA. For a while anyways i will fly Qantas, where i have never experienced a bad flight. Will not even consider flying SA until they get there game together. Was a really big let down :-(

Title: Excellent
Content: Singapore Airlines is definitely the best. Even though the tickets are slightly expensive, every dollar is worth it. Good service, comfortable seating and well prepared food made my journey with Singapore a very enjoyable one (which is often not the case with many other airlines..)

Title: Good
Content: My overall opinion about the flight was it was clean tidy, no delays however some improved customer serivce could help and better arrangements of seating. Would make for a much more enjoyable flight

Title: Excellent
Content: Had to change the flying dates due to personal & medical reasons over one of the busiest times of the year ( Christmas & New Year )and the staff went out of their way to help in the best possible way. Well done Singapore Airlines. Flew on the A380 Singapore to London and return..the flight staff and aircraft were magnificent as were the flight crew on the Perth to Singapore leg and back.

Title: Excellent
Content: My favorite airline company, its prices are very cheap comparing with the other companies. Also, I like their sweet deals which save a lot of money when booking in these sweet deals.

Title: Good
Content: I have travelled with singapore airlines many times and was very happy i chose them-I would strongly recommend this airline to anyone who is taking their baby first time overseas as their service and assistance is great-esp when your little one gives you a hard time in the journey.

Title: Good
Content: I have flown Singapore airlines a few times and they never disappoint. They are innovative, friendly and provide great service. For one thing, the airline food is more than edible  its actually tasty. They were one of the first airlines to offer personalised TV screens and the staff are always friendly and efficient. I would definitely fly with Singapore again.

Title: Excellent
Content: We loved Singapore Airlines when we travelled with them to Singapore and then Vietnam. The cabin staff's quiet attention to detail - always smiling and pleasant, unobtrusive and NEVER having little chats with each other about personal business such as other airline staff have. Nothing was too much trouble for the cabin staff on Singapore airlines and it would have to be "up there" as my airline of choice for long haul flights. The entertainment options were very good and easy to work out and the food was good too. I loved the Singapore Sling too - very refreshing indeed ! Definitely "a great way to fly".

Title: Excellent
Content: Imagine airline the way it should be, and that is Singapore Airlines. We were flying with them 8 times, and do not have a word of complain to make. Even now when all the airlines are cutting costs and with that a service as well, Singapore Airlines jumps up from all the others. We will fly with them again.

Title: Excellent
Content: Loved flying with Singapore airlines to China. They were very efficient regarding my gluten free diet and my husband's seafood allergy. The meals presented were great and they were extremely helpful to the point of calling me by phone to check on something with me. I would fly with them again in an instant and on the ay home the flight was not fully booked so after the doors had closed they allowed a lot of passengers to choose better spots to sit. Some chose front seats for leg room and some chose others so they could strech across the seat better. Even after changing seats they still kept track of where we were for our special meals and didn't miss a beat.

Title: Excellent
Content: I came to Australia a couple of yeares ago and have been going home almost evewry year since then. I really like the flight back home on singapore airlines because it is the best flight available. It has wnderful flight service, food options, on ground staff and in aur crew. Singapore airlines is also rated one of the best airlines in the world for its 5 star service and usually no turbulence on long flights, which is what I simply love about it. I would recommend singapore airlines to anyone and everyone. I simply love it.

Title: Excellent
Content: Excellent service when joining flight, onboard and departure. Nothing was too much problem. Even more SMOOTH THAN SILK on new A380

Title: Excellent
Content: Not one airline compares to Singapore Airlines. The service available throughout is amazing. Even the food is great! I'd recommend to anyone who is ale to choose Singapore Airlines on their next journey abroad.

Title: Good
Content: we flow eco class, despite my husband being harassed by female staff member the whole way it was quite entertaining. i do like singapore airlines not much to be disappointed with, good food, up to date entertainment and lots of leg room for eco class. the only thing that let them down was the disrespect of flirting and trying to get my husbands attention but i guess he gets that all the time no matter where or who he travels with.

Title: Excellent
Content: We travelled on the A380 airbus and thoroughly enjoyed it from check in to luggage collection. Really faultless. Travelling with a 3 year old can be tricky, especially on long haul flights, but those beautiful air hostesses certainly have a way with kids, and my son really enjoyed the travel as well as the great food and 'presents'! Food was terrific and the service was great too, with no shortage of drinks on demand. There was no shortage of great entertainment that would please anyone! I watched more movies than I had in ages! Fantastic and would recommend again!

Title: Excellent
Content: Singapore Airlines is my flight of choice from Adelaide to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia when I was a university student going back to my home country. The fares for the trip is very reasonable, and the flight is always comfortable and entertaining. Check-in is often quick, although there are times when the line is quite long, especially if you check in late. Staff are very friendly and helpful, and I love being served by them. The in-flight entertainment is awesome; I can choose from a range of games to play such as quizzes and "Who Wants to be a Millionaire?", listen to music singles or albums or I could watch critically-acclaimed movies released recently. I have no complaints about this airlines and would recommend it to anyone considering whether or not to try this airlines.

Title: Excellent
Content: i am a convert, will always travel using Singapore air and i strongly recommend Singapore airlines to anyone looking for a better service with a reasonable price.

Title: Excellent
Content: I leftlast year with them and the second i stepped onboard they took my bags and directed me to my seat. They then seved drinks. I aam very happy with the tv entertainment onboard it is one of the best that i have had ever. The seat space is excellent allot of room to mov, compared to others.

Title: Excellent
Content: My parents have lived overseas for a number of years now, and during that time I have travelled on multiple airlines in both economy and business class. Comparatively I think Qantas' business class is just as good if not better than Singapore Airlines. But in economy, SA has better food and better service. Also SA's frequent flyer program is much, much more generous that Qantas'. As a comparison an any seat any time flight on Singapore Airlines from Adelaide to Singapore is about 20 000-30 000 points less expensive than Qantas' equivilant. But in a tradeoff Qantas usually has cheaper tickets on the same route. Overall, Sinapore Airlines is one of my favourite airlines in ecoonomy.

Title: Good
Content: service is excellent, the crews are very attentive. you got selections of food with good quality and they taste nice too, which is quite rare for airlines food. good entertaining programs, but a bit pricey compared to other airlines at its class

Title: Excellent
Content: SA are one of the most pleasurable airlines to fly with. Friendly staff, efficient service and good inflight entertainment. Although they're not the cheapest airline, especially during peak season, they make the journey comfortable. And as most flights stop over at Changi airport, you get to recharge and relax in one of the world's best international airports.

Title: Excellent
Content: A great experience travelling SA, they were helpful, courteous and made my flight comfortable, very flexible in meeting the needs of passengers.

Title: Good
Content: singapore airlines is a fantastic airline with reasonable pricing. Their meals and service is top quality even in economy. ill fly again

Title: Excellent
Content: 1) the most professional service i have ever experienced from an airline 2) i fly regularly from Brisbane to Uk (manchester) and i can honestly say, every journey has gone without a glitch! flights on time, everytime 3) child and infant friendly 4) immaculately presented stewards and stewardesses 5) the food is FANTASTIC! i always opt for the Singapore menu, the best airline meal i've ever had 6) smooth transit from t3 to connecting flights, i love being a passenger in transit at changi airport because it is so clean, cool, relaxing and there is so much to do. The airport hotel in T3 is also fantastic, great and friendly staff, that have an excellent command of the English spoken word. Use this airline EVERY TIME for international travel!

Title: Excellent
Content: An excellent airline all round. A joy to fly with. The way one expects airlines to be. Having flown with them on numerous occassions and with other airlines too, I am yet to experience a delayed flight, loss or missplaced baggage or poor service quality -- all of which I've experienced on other leading international airlines.

Title: Excellent
Content: I recently flew from Singapore to Melbourne with Singapore Airlines for the first time. From the minute of checking in - loved Changi Airport - to leaving my whole family felt very welcomed and looked after by the staff. The food was excellent, childrens meals provided before everyone else was served and great range of entertainment including a great selection of games that you could play against other passengers.
