Title: NA
Content: I really like it because they have good room services and they didn't ever got into a crash. The people that drive on the airplane for this company is welled trained because the crashes never happened.

Title: NA
Content: Singapore Airlines is probably the best experience i've had in economy class.They offer you a hot towel before takeoff and before landing which is extremely helpful and refreshing.The entertainment system provides countless movies and TV shows.The staff are very friendly and are always trying to help youIm usually unable to sleep on flights but i slept for a good 5 hours since the seats are pretty comfortable.The 10 hours flew by really fast while flying Singapore Airlines

Title: NA
Content: Woohoo, I am in the club now!I can now brag about flying on Singapore Airlines!All I can say is WOW!Fantastic service!I flew them from Bangkok to Singapore. The entire experience was pleasant. From purchasing the ticket, pre-boarding, inflight service and contacting them afterward to get my mileage points. Extremely professional airline.When boarding the flight, I could smell the food warming up and it made me very hungry. The food was amazing!I think it was chicken curry along with some sides. The drinks came around often which was very nice as well. I liked their interactive entertainment system. The service was out of this world and all of the Singapore Girls were stunningly beautiful!It was one of those flights I wish never ended! I'll certainly make it a point to fly Singapore Airlines as much as possible.

Title: NA
Content: I could see the immediately see the difference between my preferred carrier and Singapore Airlines when I walked up to the ticket counter. Normally, I am greeted by a machine and have to wait for the one or two agents to visit me because they are covering multiple check-in stations at the same time. Not so at Singapore. In fact, I actually had three people there to help me, all with smiles and warm greetings. Check-in was fast and easy. Within moments, I was given my boarding pass and a slip of paper to admit me to the Star Alliance Lounge before takeoff.  Sweet.Boarding the plan is also different. The gate agent simply strolled up to the podium and said we could all now board the plane. There was not this cattle call of people herding into special lanes or jockeying for position to be the first on the plane. Just people casually walking onto a plane and easily placing their bags and luggage into the abundant overhead storage bins.So, first impression: 1. The cabin seating. Seeing row after row of large business class seating with the lay flat beds) was terrific. Normally, I am sitting in the standard cramped and tiny tourist cabin seats and I could not stomach the thought of trying to fall asleep in one of those on a flight for 16 hours. (No, those silly neck roll things to not work for me and I cannot sleep upright) The seats are large and roomy. Even the largest American bottom could easily fit in these seats! The seats recline and there is a space to prop up your feed for added comfort. The seats also fold down into a lay-flat configuration for sleeping. Heavy blankets are provided to keep you warm, although the cabin temperature is quite warm without having to use the blanket. I wouldn't say the bed rivals a memory foam mattress in comfort, but it isn't bad and certainly gets the job done. If you are a bit taller (6' or taller), you'll have to do a bit of the fetal position sleeping. The entertainment system is filled with movies and TV shows to keep you occupied when not sleeping. There is power to keep your laptop running and recharge your cell phone. Don't worry about bringing along your noise cancelling headset because one is provided. Yours wouldn't work anyway as the plug is an odd three-pronged thing that I know does not come standard with headsets like Bose. I've been in United's Business Class seats and these do seem roomier. Grab a seat by the window as the privacy panels on the side of the seat and the staggered spacing ensures that you can't see your neighbor and they can't see you.  2. The cabin crew.  OK, so I will admit the crew is attractive. The women all wear the same patterned dress/uniform and look terrific. I suppose the men too are attractive, but I honestly didn't notice! Across both genders, however, their smiles and desire to assist the passengers seem genuine. After the dinner service (the Sea Bass was cooked perfectly) and a few glasses of really good scotch, I decided to close my eyes and rest. I put on the provided eye mask to block out the light. After just a few minutes, I felt a light tap on my shoulder. The flight attendant assigned to my area politely asked if I knew how to fold down my bed into the lay-flat position and she offered to help. In fact, I didn't know and was grateful she set me straight from the beginning. After that, my nap turned into several hours of deep sleep. My attendant even came and gave me a bottle of water, placing it in my "cup holder". When I went to reach for it later, I discovered she already opened the bottle, cracking the seal and leaving the cap lightly screwed on the bottle. I don't have arthritis so I could have done that myself, but that attention to detail is impressive.3. The bathrooms. They certainly can be described as clean and pleasant. Each bathroom comes complete with shaving kits, mouthwash, nice smelling soaps and lotions. They have cologne for both men and women. Even the towels, which are cotton, are infused with a pleasant scent. The sinks are larger than what I am used to, making it easier to get my entire hand under the faucet to freshen up.  And there seem to be an adequate number of them as there isn't the usual long line of passengers at the end of the aircraft waiting for a bathroom to open up. I will admit, the disposable razor they provided cut my face up a bit. The downside:1. The Internet - $25 for 30MB of usage. I used up my allotment very quickly after just a few quick emails and some standard web surfing. If you want to use the Internet, I suggest you forgo web surfing or updating your facebook status until you land. Craft all of your emails beforehand and then connect so that you won't burn through your MB's as quickly as I did. 2. 17+ hours of flight time. This isn't Singapore Airlines fault... it is just a looonnnggg time to be in the air!

Title: NA
Content: I flew them international from Singapore to Beijing in July '13. The flight service was good, but the only reason I flew them was that they are Star Alliance and I wanted the miles. Come to find out they have fare class restrictions. V, Q, G, N or T classes don't get miles on Star Alliance partners, and this wasn't obvious when I bought the ticket. Bottom line for Star flyers - fly some other airline that doesn't have this unfriendly policy.

Title: NA
Content: Always the best! Even to those in economy ...

Title: NA
Content: There are really no appropriate words I can find for Singapore Airlines, other than FLAW-FREE. Their prices are competitive, and their standards for comfort and service greatly exceed that of any other airline I've flown with - and for those interested, I make my comparison against Lufthansa, Air France, United, JAL, Aeroflot, Jeju Air, and LOT.My flights with them are 10-12 hours in duration. I generally don't like flying (not to mention fear of heights!) but they make it bearable. Each time, I boarded one of their Boeing 777-300ER's. On the plane, each seat had its own screen with a remote, which operates a comprehensive entertainment system. I was thoroughly impressed, browsing through all the choices of movies, dramas, and music that they had to offer. They have virtually any genre of music or motion picture that you can think of. Throughout the entire plane ride, I didn't even find the need to take out my iTouch or DS! The in-flight service was equally wonderful, as the famous Singapore Girls did not disappoint.The attendants were all very hospitable and friendly - not to mention attentive! Drinks and snacks were being brought by around the clock, they even offered some wine and cocktails (an offer I took advantage of!) Passengers were fed an entire three meals within each flight, with the meals being so sumptuous that, by the 2nd mealtime, I was unable to finish all of my food.I'm going to be flying with them again in the coming spring, and I rather look forward to it!

Title: NA
Content: Loved my flight to and from S.Korea....Flight attendants were so sweet. Accommodated my needs as I fractured my ankle during my trip. Thank you Singapore Airlines!!!!

Title: NA
Content: Having flown domestic airlines for a while, I had forgotten that flying could be fun... that is, until I flew Singapore Airlines recently. Where to start? Helpful, charming and competent attendants. Meticulous attention to detail e.g. restrooms were clean, spacious (esp. the baby-changing one) and water drains in the sink automatically. Endless food anytime you want. Numerous high quality movies (watched "The Social Network" and "Inception"). Even the long 16 hour flight didn't diminish the sense of fun. Especially as I landed in the beautiful Singapore airport with flowers and trees outside the windows, and a KOI POND and BUTTERFLY GARDEN inside the airport. Wish I could fly Singapore Airlines everywhere.

Title: NA
Content: Easily the best flying experience of my life. From the comfort of the laydown seats, to quality of the food (best and most plentiful I've ever had on a plane), to the warm and attentive service, there is simply nothing that could have been done better. This is all based on a flight from SFO through Singapore and finally to Bangalore, India. I will absolutely fly them again when going to Asia.

Title: NA
Content: After managing to leave something of great importance at HKG transit security (I was a zombie for this experience) and subsequently not realizing it until ANOTHER connection later in Bangkok (SFO-HKG-SIN-BKK), I experienced 6+ star customer service.Not only did they manage to track down this object (small, inconspicuous) via HKG lost and found, with daily progress updates, they then put in on an SQ flight to meet me in a totally different airport, where an agent greeted me - just as promised - and handed the item over.The inflight service, comfort, and food are all class leaders (in economy - that's all I've experienced). The ground and ancillary staff were exemplary for any company in any industry, and are in a class of their own.

Title: NA
Content: My parents were terribly harassed by your airlines on their recent roundtrip. The flight attendants were extremely rude, dont respond. There was severe shortage of food. They are elderly people and your flight attendants got irritated if called and often would come and turn off light without asking what is needed. On a nearly 40 hour trip, it is a terrible shame that your treat your customers this way especially seniors. After suffering such terrible behavior from your staff , their entire luggage is lost. After a nearly 40 hour haul, they were waiting for ages looking for their luggage until they had to go and find out it was lost. When they further tried inquiring, the singapore airlines staff was unhelpful, in fact they were rude, abusive and misbehaved very badly. They were insisting my parents to turn over their luggage stickers , which is the only proof of luggage we have. On refusal to do so, they misbehaved and shouted at them. I don't know how you train your staff, but they lack basic etiquette and human skills treating senior people like this. It is a shame for your airlines. We have not received the luggage yet, still waiting for it to show up.

Title: NA
Content: Bad customer service was totally unexpected from Singapore Airline. But today, I found Singapore Airlines has the WORST customer service. I called 3 times and the person who took my call just dropped me. On the last call at least I had a conversation, but the person on the line told me, "you're breaking" and told me to call back. I called using an Iphone and tested my home phone - both worked okay.  I agree with greg I...a huge pain in the butt.

Title: NA
Content: I freaking love this airline. There's something about a plane, that as soon as I sit down..boom. I fall asleep. That's usually a good thing when everyone on the plane has to watch the same movie, the seats are uncomfortable, there's crappy service and crappy snacks..Even though I was able to sleep the majority of my flight..the time I was awake was very pleasant. First, the ladies and gents workin the plane are smokin. Even the older men are silver foxes. You get a hot towel as soon as you get on. Good to wipe your face. Especially when you were just hammered with India's heat and dust. Gross. The snacks are first class. The drinks are plentiful. Don't forget the free alcohol. (One guy next to me loaded up on cognac like there was no tomorrow.)The meals are quite nice. And you get TONS OF ICE CREAM!! You get a nice amount of leg room, each chair has a tv..You can watch movies (new movies too, I watched a movie that was in theaters a couple months back only), tv shows, play video games, listen to music, etc. You name it. They got it. And oh my god, Changi airport. The best damn airport EVER!I would totally fly with them again next time I go out of the country. For this reason. After a 14+ hour flight I walked off the plane and I didn't even feel like murdering anybody.

Title: NA
Content: We have been loyal Singapore Airlines customers for a long time, flying trans-pacific round-trips every year. However, this year the experience was really horrible when we missed a connecting flight.We missed our connection in Singapore on 08 August 2013 through an oversight on our part - we were tired from an overnight flight and mistakenly thought our connecting flight was SQ016 at 9:25 AM instead of SQ600 at 8 AM. By the time we realized the mistake and scrambled to the departure gate for SQ600, the gate had closed - we were late by 2 minutes. We were directed to 'Singapore Airlines Transfer Desk' to rebook on SQ016. Singapore Airlines Customer Service Representative was more interested in charging us a 'No Show Penalty' than trying to assist us get on another flight. We paid $100 for each ticket as 'Penalty'. This is the first time in 30 years of flying that I have ever been asked to pay a penalty for 'No Show'. After paying the fee and waiting for an hour to be put on 'Stand-by', we were finally told there were no seats available on SQ16. We were directed to go out to the 'Departure' area and seek assistance from 'Singapore Airlines Reservations Desk'. We went through immigration and on to Singapore Airlines Reservations desk. Singapore Airlines Customer Service patiently listened to us but in the end was not helpful. They informed us that all flights from Singapore to SFO or LAX were completely full for the next 5 days. There was nothing they could do to help us. They offered to put us on 'Stand-by' for SQ002 at 5:50 PM. We were asked to retrieve our checked luggage from Terminal 2 (where we had disembarked) and re-check them in on the SQ002 if we were able to make stand-by. We went to Terminal 2 'Lost and Found' to retrieve our two bags, and were told the luggage was actually in Terminal 3. We trudged back to Terminal 3 'Lost and Found' and finally retrieved the luggage. We stood in line for SQ002 and at 5:10 were told the flight was full. There was nothing 'Singapore Airlines Check-in Staff' could do to help us! We could try go stand-by for the next flight next day and so on for the next 5 days.This was an unacceptable offer. I have a job to go to and the expense of staying in Singapore for 5 days would far exceed the cost of buying new tickets. So we decided to do the only practical thing and buy one-way tickets on another Airline. We flew out to San Francisco on Korean/United Air later that same night. We sent a formal complaint to Singapore Airlines and they curtly told us to talk to our travel agent! You know the true color of an Airline by how they assist their customers when something goes wrong, not when everything works as planned. We will never fly Singapore Airlines again!

Title: NA
Content: I don't consider myself an expert traveler by any means. There are plenty of people who travel on a weekly basis, and by comparison, I might still be considered a novice in the field of air transportation. However, for someone who goes on trips purely for pleasure 90% of the time, I would say that I do fly quite a bit more frequently than most of my peers. I average about 3 international and 20 domestic trips per year for the past couple years, so I'm definitely not new to the enclosed environment that we all fondly cough know as airplanes.Unfortunately, I haven't won the lottery. I hope that someday I will make enough to be able to fly Business or First on my own accomplishments, but for now, I have to settle for Economy like most of the traveling community to be able to appease my huge appetite for wanderlust. For those who have been on those 12+ hour trips abroad, you know it's not the most ideal situation. Seats are usually a little more cramped than you would like, the food is almost always less than par, and amenities? Forget it. Consider yourself lucky if you're able to somehow procure a toothbrush. I flew with Singapore Air for the first time about a week ago simply because the flight time was the most convenient, and I must say that I have never been more pleasantly surprised by an airline in my life. There were obvious pluses that one simply could not ignore. First, there was much more legroom than any other Economy cabin I've ever sat in. Second, the personal screens were actually rather large, extremely clear, and had the largest selection of movies, shows, and music I've ever had the pleasure of being able to choose from. On top of all that, the bathrooms were COLOSSAL! And clean!!! With simply all of the aforementioned qualities, I would easily have been satisfied. However, it was the smaller attention to detail that really set Singapore Air apart in my mind. To start, each of the seats had footrests that you could pull down. Trust me. It helps. A lot. But to be fair, I've been on other flights with footrests, so that might not be an enormously unique aspect. The bathrooms also had faucets that you didn't have the hold down to dispense water. Instead, they were the kind that you push down once to get a couple seconds of flow. Convenient. The trashcans inside also had a pedal you push down with your foot to open, so you don't have to touch the disgusting flap and soil your hands. Amazing for a germaphobe such as myself. At the beginning of the flight, they also passed out small Givenchy pouches that contained a toothbrush, toothpaste, and a pair of comfortable, disposable socks that you could wear if you so chose to kick off your shoes. Don't mind if I do! Lastly, the food was not half bad gasp, and the cabin service was impeccable. They even gave us ice cream sandwiches for dessert! Yayyyy! I looooove ice cream! I know some of these might not seem like a big deal, but all of them together really make a big difference when you're stuck inside a small space for half of an entire day (or more).All in all, I would recommend flying with SA if it were ever an option, even if it was to cost a little more than the cheapest alternative. And to whoever is running the show, I'd like to give a big round of applause. It is very apparent that they care about their customer, and because of that, they've gained a new loyal patron in me.

Title: NA
Content: A huge pain in the butt. I bought a ticket for my GF. I had to go down to SFO to turn in "Letter of Indemnity". Some how they lost it. So now I have to go back to the airport and do the process all over again.

Title: NA
Content: It's clear that Singapore Airlines puts all their effort into in-flight experience and everything else, like web site and reservation system, is pretty poor. If you can buy a ticket and don't need to change it, you'll probably have the best in-flight experience possible on an airplane although that isn't saying much. Singapore Airlines is all hype; it's just another airline.When I tried to buy the tickets off the web site, it took several tries, particularly with a giant page of information with fields that would randomly reset and error messages that were confusing. Finally, I did figure out the "magic combination" of values that would cause the web site to work.Singapore Airlines totally and completely failed me and endangered my family. When my family had a serious medical emergency and needed to return home early, it was a nightmare. The call center couldn't help and my "confirmed" reservations were randomly canceled. Each day, I'd wake up to check the web site to see what was screwed up overnight. I spent hours on the phone although I must admit that I usually got through quickly. They also gave me a lot of erroneous and incorrect information, probably because they didn't know, not because they lied. Mostly, they just sent e-mails to the seat controller/head office/waitlist dept which was ineffective (to say the least).BTW, (65) 6223-8888 and (800) 742-3333 go to the same call center (at least when I wrote this). The guy from (65) 6223-8888 confirmed that he works in the same building as supervisors from (800) 742-3333. (65) 6223-8888 has no more/less authority than (800) 742-3333; they just speak different languages. Sometimes, (800) 742-3333 gives (65) 6223-8888 as a "higher authority" even though it's not true; I don't know why. Just more misinformation that the call center gives out.I went to San Francisco Airport but they have no offices there. The check-in people have no power or authority and weren't any help. They gave me the number of the San Francisco Singapore Airlines office which was even more useless and clueless than the call center.The real problem was all the misinformation that the web site, call center and offices fed me. I would understand if the web site, call center and offices couldn't help as long as they gave me accurate status and options and explanations. But I got fed way too much misinformation. Despite being stuck overseas for days on end and fed false hope that we'd get a flight by Singapore Airlines' unethical behavior and operation, my family luckily recovered from their medical issues overseas. But my family could have died due to Singapore Airlines callousness and ineffectiveness.I sued Singapore Airlines in Small Claims Court but lost (bad luck). I wasted some of their time and money, though: Singapore Airlines had to send somebody from San Francisco for most of the day. I suggest that everybody do the same; even if you lose, you can be happy that you were a nuisance to them. It's also cheap and easy. I will be filing a complaint with FAA.One dirty little secret of Singapore Airlines: Singapore Airlines flies planes with economy class full and business class mostly empty so they can jack up prices for business class. When they say that the plane is "full", that just means that economy class is full so they can upsell you a business class ticket.Another dirty little secret: the clunky reservation system often reports economy class as full for the first few minutes to try upsell you a business class ticket. But, if you join the waitlist and wait 10 or 20 minutes, the flight will suddenly become available/confirmed. Ha, ha! Another dirty trick to try to upsell you a business class ticket, a way to fool you into thinking that business class is your only option.To return home, I figured out a way to use my return ticket for one leg and then buy a ticket on a different airline for the leg that Singapore had constantly full. A quality customer service operation would have suggested this.The in-flight experience is good although I don't really get why people say it is great. The food may be "great" for an airline but, of course, if I was on the ground, I'd never choose to eat it. It reminds me of a kid's school lunch. The in-flight entertainment may be "great" for an airline but it's hardly the way to enjoy a movie. If I could be somewhere else, I would be.I've flown on EVA Air a lot, too, and, really, it's pretty much the same as Singapore Airlines for me. Singapore Airlines is all hype.

Title: NA
Content: I am writing to express utter disappointment in my experience with Singapore airlines.I am scheduled to travel in June with two kids aged 3 and 7 from SFO to New DelhiI made this booking well in advance on the 7th of January 2012.My daughter has a health issue 3 days prior to travel and the doctor has advised for her not to travel prior to the 14th of June.  To ensure the health of passengers is not compromised, ensure there is no Liability to Singapore airlines, and in the best interest of my daughter I called Singapore airlines to reschedule my outbound flight after the 14th of June. I also submitted the doctors certificate.The 1-800-743-3333 toll free number connects me to a call center in India that has ZERO authority and I keep getting the run around. I have made 8 calls in the last two days which has been a very frustrating experience. They keep contacting the Singapore Airline local office in Los Angeles and keep hearing back that Singapore airlines will force me to pay the fare difference of $450 each (Total $1350) if I need to push my travel out to the 14th of June inspite of the fact my daughter has a health issue.I am very disappointed that an airline I held in such high regard has ZERO compassion and is NOT willing to change the date at NO COST out of good faith.Update - To my review...The Ground Staff at SFO is TRULY AMAZING....I want to make a special mention for Mr. Loh who was the station leader on the 15th of June!...He was super compassionate and made sure my Wife and Kids got on the plane...Singapore DEL connection was not confirmed - He sent special message to Singapore to ensure my wife gets on Sing - DEL or Sing - BOM connection...Very Very Helpful and Very Very Nice...Call center still sucks - But I guess I'll live with that...

Title: NA
Content: Singapore Airlines still does not disappoint.  Their level of service is beyond Outstanding and far outweighs the level of service or comfort any American carrier.Although their ticket prices are not always the most inexpensive, they are worth the few extra bucks because I know I will be treated well by an attentive crew and excellent food.  Thank you SIA!!

Title: NA
Content: ive flown singapore airlines every year for the past 5 years from sfo to seoul, korea because they always have the best prices. i think its due to no mileage, but their service is great, and their airplane food is one of the few ill eat. only thing is they're located at the very end of the international terminal, but gives me time to mosy around after checking out the duty free shops. their staff are all really accomodating and super friendly. i love how all the seats have it's own tv screen with movies, tv shows, and games to play.i was lucky to fly with them business class in december, and i love the pull out bed, and the 3 course meals were nice. the bathrooms are great for airplane bathrooms as well!love singapore and will be flying with them on my next trip to korea!

Title: NA
Content: I have nothing but high praises for Singapore Airlines. Singapore Airlines is the standard that many look up to when it comes to air travel. With their iconic "Singapore Girl," and the high standards the cabin crew are held accountable for, you can expect friendly and down to earth service while cruising to your destination. I have flown with Singapore Airlines on numerous occasions and have been pleased with the service on every single flight. The cabin crew really seem to enjoy what they do and you can see it as they are very customer service friendly. When is the last time you've flown and you've been greeted by name throughout the entire flight? If you fly predominantly in the US I'm sure your answer is probably not too often. Singapore Airlines does the little things right that other carriers fail to do. The onboard services are wonderful too from the food/beverages, in-flight entertainment, and cleanliness of the aircraft. Yes the food is good :) In regards to entertainment none of that continuous looping. It's all on demand so you get to watch or listen when you want. On this trip I flew from Singapore to Tokyo and then from Hong Kong back to Singapore. My flight from Singapore to Tokyo was on a Boeing 747-400 and fortunately I was flying in First. It was so nice to see the SkySuites again. For passengers flying in Business or First you have the option to Book the Cook (BTC). The BTC allows you to pre-order your meal from a list of other menu items. These items range from lobster thermidor to local specialties. For this sector I decided I would BTC the Kyo-Kaiseki, which is a Japanese selection featuring many small plates. No trip on Singapore Airlines in First would be complete without a glass of Dom Perignon. Yes they serve both Dom and Krug. The meal service on SQ is a perfect dining experience in the skies. Everything is done with precision whether it's the direction of your glass with the "F" logo lined up to the location of the utensils. First Class passengers are also given amenity kits by Salvatore Ferragamo and sleeper suits by Givenchy. The men's amenity kit included an Incanto Pour Homme Assortment of Eau De Toilette Incanto Pour Homme, after shave emulsion incanto pour homme, lip balm tuscan soul, and hand cream moisturizer tuscan soul. All of the goodies in the amenity kit come in a nice travel bag. The sleeper suits are like sweat pants with a quarter zip matching top. I can't tell you how nice it is to arrive at your destination in with a fresh set of clothes since you can fly in the sleeper suits. In all instances a member of the cabin crew will hang your clothes in the closet for you so you don't need to find a place to store your clothes. Once you're ready to get some rest the SkySuite is transformed into a lie flat bed by a member of the cabin crew. The sky suite is lined with an additional mattress pad for added comfort and topped off with a warm duvet. When you wake up rest assured you will be greeted with a warm towel and a beverage. It's always quite depressing to leave the lovely confines of the SkySuite. Upon deplaning you are thanked by name by the cabin crew. I can't stress enough how nice it is to feel so welcomed when flying Singapore Airlines. My Hong Kong - Singapore flight was on a Boeing 777 in First. While they used a regional aircraft for this route the services were equally superb. They don't have SkySuites on their regional aircraft, but this really isn't such a big deal for their short haul flights. I had initially BTC, the lobster thermidor, but went for the "Shi Quan Shi Mei," otherwise known as "a complete and perfect chinese culinary experience."I urge you all to splurge once in a lifetime and fly Singapore Airlines in one of their premium cabins. You won't be disappointed!"Singapore Girl, you're a great way to fly."

Title: NA
Content: I am providing feedback to their website and that it experiences a lot of technical problems. While I was booking my flight online, it took many tries before it accepted my meal selection and my membership number. I had to edit the screen many times, and yet my membership number is still not added. In addition, I purchased the Kris package (the middle pricing), so that I can make changes to my flight without charge and that I can earn mileage rewards. However, while I was trying to make changes to my flight to change to a different time, I was unable to do that online and said that I needed to contact 800 support. Which I did, and that leads to my 2nd concern. The contact number for reservations I contacted was +1 (800) 742-3333,and the representatives I spoke with can NEVER hear me and always states that I am breaking up on my end of the line. I originally called them with my cell phone, and I thought that may have been a problem, so I used my landline instead. Even though I used my landline, they still had the same problem. So I provided my phone number for them to call me back, and yet the same problem with "I can't hear you" and "you are breaking up" is occurring. I was getting really annoyed at this point. I decided to call back during the morning, and try in the afternoon and the evening but I get the same messages. Therefore, I inquired and asked where is the reservation call center located and they said India, which is not a problem, however, not being able to get serviced was the main issue. I believe Singapore Airlines is a preferred airline provider and also given the award to rank number 1 last year as being the best airline, which was one of the reasons why I chose Singpore for my recent vacation. As I was getting frustrated with the customer service experience, I contact the local office in San Francisco, and the number was 650-821-8800 and see if I had better luck. Yet, no luck there either. The voicemail I received wasn't pleasant either, she states that she is very busy and that I won't be returning messages in a timely fashion and to contact the 800 number above instead. I left multiple messages, however, I have not heard from anyone. In the end, I did not have the time and energy to keep dealing with this, so I had to adjust my work schedule and stick with the flight that I have booked. I am very disappointed at Singapore Airlines as I purchased the ticket for convenience and when I needed it, I wasn't able to get the service I paid for. I will not recommend Singapore Airlines to my friends and family. I am giving it 2 stars as the service in-flight was a good experience. The flight attendants were nice and friendly and the food served was good. They had a good selection of movies to choose from.

Title: NA
Content: I always fly with SQ in any long haul flights. The service is unbeatable and is worth the occasional extra $$ when compared with other airlines. The stewards and stewardess are always friendly and accomodating. I have never had to ask anyone for help to put my bags up on the overhead compartment on SQ, but on occasion had had to bear through grimmace with some unnamed Australian and British airlines. Inflight entertainment is awesome and I recommend their oriental vegetarian meals. This is my airline of choice for myself and my family. I'm particularly impressed that the cabin crew made extra effort for older passengers who did not understand the standard English and Mandarin. On a recent flight, I was seated next to a solo-flying elder gentleman who needed extra help and I was so glad to see that the cabin crew was accomodating to him. Knowing the SQ standard of service, I would definitely put my parents on SQ when they visit me with a peace of mind . Keep up the good work SQ!

Title: NA
Content: What else can I say, but "Singapore Gal, You're a Great Way to Fly!"I'd give them a 6 or 7 star ovation if possible. Especially whence traveling in their First Class Suites longhaul journeys. It's been awhile since I've flown, but I can honestly tell you, it's worth EVERY penny if you have to "slum" in Commercial First Class. I've flown private in the past, but I think SQ is still better... AND it's part of Star Alliance so I get my points/status as well.Even if not in the longhaul First Class Suites, their normal FIRST CLASS or RAFFLES CLASS are just as great and kick the arses off any other airline carrier. REALLY!From the ambience, service, food, amenities, comfort, offerings, and elegance, you surely will be pampered on these flights.I like the way we have a dedicated First Class Concierge service from beginning to end... ESPECIALLY in Singapore Changi Airport. I have the driver pull up to the First Class Zone outside, and from there, an SQ First Class Customer Service Personnel will greet me at the car, and a porter will take my luggage. The Staff will escort me to a private First Class Check In Lounge where there's a Full Stocked Bar and Refreshments available while waiting. Once checked in and suitcases on their way towards the aircraft, I'm escorted through a Private Hall and into a Special Lane that goes directly to Immigration for a Fast Procedure, and I'm escorted to either the First Class Lounge inside the Departure Terminal or I can shop around the FABULOUS DUTY FREE SHOPS inside the airport. It's like a high end luxury mall within the Singapore Changi Airport!All this happens with the Staff following me, but normally I ask them to go back as I don't need their assistance after check in. In SF, it's not as grandiose the service, however, you still feel special and you KNOW the difference between service from SQ and that of American carriers.... no comparison as SQ is so much better!Please, if you get the chance, fly SQ First Class Suites for longhaul journeys. If you can't, well, at least try them for anything as their Economy Class is still better than the First or Business Class of American carriers (except for space and offerings).

Title: NA
Content: I have flown well over 1,000,000 miles with Singapore Airlines. Punctuality and service has always been far superior to any of the many other airlines on which I have traveled. All these flights, an average of 76 per year, to/from Singapore in the '90's made air travel a pleasure.

Title: NA
Content: I'm giving them 3 stars because, for me (at 6'5" tall) the only thing that matters is legroom. I fly in economy to Asia, 3-4 times per year. I've tried them all (Air China, United, Singapore etc. within Star Alliance) and they are all equally bad, except that United has Economy Plus (aka "Kennel Plus" which is slightly better ... Singapore Airlines might even be a tiny bit worse than average since they have an annoying metal footrest (how could anyone but a child ever use that?) that impinges on your shins when sitting down.Service is pleasant, food and snacks are ample and the drinks flow freely but are of moderate to low quality. The price was good ($800 R/T to Seoul) and the one thing that does attract me to that airline is their "Flexi-Saver" tickets which are only a little more expensive but allow you to change your flight dates relatively painlessly. I have used that feature on occasion.

Title: NA
Content: This is the first time I flew Singapore airlines (Silk Air) The experience is incomparable. I have travelled extensively in various airlines including Emirates, KLm, Lufthansa among others. I and my wife felt a comfortable trip in check in, inflight food, leg space courtesy, transit help ( my wife demanded a wheel chair services). We decided to stick on to Singapore airlines if the route time and rates are suitable.

Title: NA
Content: Great Airlines... its really amazing to have such kind of service. Customer Care is awesome ... Airline staff is friendly .. flights are safe an on time ... no words to describe such a great experience. The local offices are also helpful.

Title: NA
Content: Nothing more to say .. SINGAPORE AIRLINES is the best .. I have been using SIngapore Airline since I was 1 year old and now im 20 ..SQ is still my favorite Airline.. I wish I can fly Singapore Airline to HKG this time but they are all full : (

Title: NA
Content: wow. the system is crazy. i called the air line rep to change the flight date. they put me on hold every single time & they checked RSVP time, name, number. as we have 3 passengers, they made me go though on line system for me to check out and check in as they couldn't do it themselves. after taking 2 hours checking the flight availability and process... freaking 2 hours as they put me on hold every single time they check some little thing, they wanted me to go on-line to cancel the check in. Thus, i went on-line to cancel the check in. once on-line, i wasn't able to do so as they somehow lock me out. Thus, they said that they will call the sing airline airport to cancel that. after that, they wanted me to call them back?. it nearly took me 3 hours and they weren't able to do a crap, i want them to take care of it they weren't able to or they don't have the capability? wow what the fuck is that?. i again called after 3 hours to cancel the check in on line, the system wasn't updated so i called the customer service again and they said they are still working on it and made wait another 1 hour and call back. so i called back after one hour.... they put me on a hold 4 times to check few simple answers. again.... they asked me to call them back again. what the hell is wrong with these people? So... i need to fly out and i already spent thousands of dollars to buy the god damn tickets, so i called them back to see if they ve done their job. However, they put me on hold for another 20 min and they said to call them back again. Finally when my flight left, they were able too change the stupid date. i again had to go onlne to check in this process took me another 2hours. in few hours later they called me back and said i had to pay 22 dollars per each person. they put me on hold again and again and paid 22 dollars which took me another 1 hour for 3 people.... i am not exaggerating. This is seriouosly nightmare... seriously this is a nightmare system... airline is decent but they make the customer service experience a horrible nightmare....12:47PM i just call them again because customer service didn't send me the confirmation or itinerary info as promised. so i had to call them again to get this info.

Title: NA
Content: If I had the option I'd fly with Singapore every time. I recently flew with them to Seoul and that 11 hour flight seemed like it took 3. Coach is super comfortable, the service is excellent, and the entertainment choices daunting.Plus when you ask for a scotch and soda they go in the back and mix it for you. That's pretty righteous.

Title: NA
Content: Singapore Airlines exceeded my expectations. Its the only way to fly to Asia. Leg room: Good enough for a 6'3", 210 lbs guy like me (except when the guy in front of you lays in your lap). So its best to sit in the emergency exit row if your large or like the leg room. Food: It was pretty good. They give you food on a one hour ride between Singapore and Malaysia; and it was much more than peanuts. The dinners were edible with beef in a red wine sauce, or chicken stuffed with chesse, and smoked salmon salad. No charge for wine and beer. Entertainment: When 18 hours seems long....Singapore Airlines makes it seem short. You will have your own 4" monitor with movies not even on video yet. Other Notables: No charge for more than 1 bag checked, they didnt even charge me for my bag being over 50 lbs. I love how they give you a hot towel before eating. I just wish they can keep people from farting on the plane! (WTF, I mean really...WTF)

Title: NA
Content: My incident happen a few months ago at SFO (San Francisco International Airport) during the check process. Unfortunately, I have to travel this airline again, soon, since they seem to be the only game in town get to where I need to go. So here is my complaint again with the hope my family does not have to endure the kind of service we have had with Singapore Airlines in the past. BTW, I find that Delta and Southwest have far better ground staff customer service than Singapore Airlines, there is no comparison.Basically, we flew out of SFO to Singapore. The check-in staff who I will not mention, was rude, unprofessional and overall, extremely unpleasant, rushed us through the process. We were not given proper weight and size instructions for carry-on baggage which created issues at the gate. But what got to me is the rudeness of the service staff at check-in which I have never experienced before from any airline. Most of the check-in staff are young, probably just out of college. Their training is sub-par. They seem to be unable or incapable of dealing with the fast paced and/or stressful situations as arise when checking in 400+ people for an international flight.

Title: NA
Content: I flew them in March and then again last month, and I'm quite impressed with the Singapore coach class experience. It helps that Singapore flies new 777s on its SFO routes with newly redesigned seats and an in-flight entertainment system whose offerings can't be exhausted even on an 18-hour flight, it's that good.Service. The famed Singapore flight attendants are as good as advertised, maybe some are a little over-trained and robotic but most are genuinely caring and a far cry from United's grouchy prison wardens. If there's a downside, it's that Singapore Airlines' regular passengers are aware of this and seem to be a little more high-maintenance. I noticed the dinner service from SFO to HKG seemed to take forever as row after row of passengers made lengthy special requests as the flight attendants delivered their food. I wonder if any of them were asked to cut someone's meat.Other than that, this is one of the best airlines around, easily.And the rating isn't about Singapore, but it's a cool place to visit, shop, and eat!

Title: NA
Content: Singapore Airlines and Cathay Pacific are the best carriers I've been on.  I've flown on Singapore Airlines multiple times between the US and Asia. I've never had a bad experience. What makes them different is mostly the service. The flight attendants are friendly and attentive. They anticipate and you feel like they actually like / care about you. They do little things like if you fall asleep, they'll put a blanket on you and turn off your reading light. They come by multiple times to make sure you have enough water and drinks. They smile and are courteous when they speak to you. They're definitely not hard on the eyes which helps their image and tend to be in their 20's and sometimes 30's (they live up to their Singapore Girl Ad slogan). I see American/Euro salesmen types hit on the flight attendants on just about every flight. They always handle the situation in a friendly yet firm manner.....It's kind of funny to watch. Other pluses: The food is good; They speak English well. Oh, and being the national carrier of Singapore (known to be the cleanest place in the world), the planes are spotless. All airlines should be like Singapore and Cathay Pacific Airlines.

Title: NA
Content: Singapore airlines have gotten to their head. The service is not as they claim. They are unfriendly nowadays and they damaged my luggage and failed to do anything about it. Plus their layover time check-in again in Seoul is painful.

Title: NA
Content: Be aware that they not refund Miles to United Miles Plus program if tickets bought at discounted rate. And you cannot find out about rate unless you already bought tickets. If you want miles - book other affiliates

Title: NA
Content: It seems to me that all non-American airlines perform much better than their American counterparts. I've never liked American airliners as I've found that both food and service is much better on both Asian (EVA, Singapore) and European (Lufthansa) airlines. Anyway, I was able to exchange my UA miles for a couple of Singapore Airline flights. I've only flown on one leg of my travels but I had such an awesome time that I just KNOW flying back to the US will be just as fun. First of all, the airplane is clean and my economy seat had all necessary and convenient amenities. Cupholder up top as well as the usual pull out tray from the side armrest. Magazines in the front pocket were organized, clean, and new (not grimy and scary to stick your hand in). The service was impeccable. The steward/esses were all very refreshing, polite, and efficient. I much prefer them to the grumpy old frumps on its unnamed American partners in the Star Alliance. The food as for airplane food is pretty tasty as well. Make sure to check out their special meals because they offer a TON if you have any dietary restrictions (ranging from Indian vegetarian to all fruit meal and from no carb to Chinese style meal). Finally, most importantly, their IN FLIGHT ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEM rocks my world. I didn't sleep a wink on my SFO-ICN(Seoul) flight. Even sitting in Economy, I was able to watch anything and everything on-demand. They literally have nearly hundreds of movies in each category (American, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Bollywood, European, etc) as well as a good international mix of tv programs, CDs, radio shows, etc etc. If I had the money and the choice, I would definitely fly this for all my international flights.

Title: NA
Content: Eugy was so excited to take Singapore Air. He kepted saying over and over again how sexy their uniforms were. Um, they're not that sexy babe.. Sheesh... Overall, I like this airline, but I will never fly with them in coach, ever again. WAAAAAAAAAY too many crying babies... And WAAAAAAAAAAY too crowded. I do like their inflight entertainment however. Good selection of movies, tv shows, games and music. The food is decent, but nothing to get excited about.

Title: NA
Content: First off, I can't believe we are ranking airlines on Yelp. Secondly, since we are, anyone that ranks this less than 5-star is high. Singapore is prized as being one of the best airlines in the world. They will practically carry you on the plane. For service, food, entertainment, it does not get better here. Trust me, I've flown scores of international carriers and the only airline that comes close is Emirates and Malaysian. (Please note, have not yet flown Cathay.) Sure, there are occasional screw-ups, we are all human, but compare this to United and you'll laugh. Lastly, since we are doing airline reviews, I guess I am going to have to review Bangladesh Biman Airlines.

Title: NA
Content: We had a great experience flying from SFO to MES. We were treated welcomed and treated as honored customers for the entire trip. I would choose Singapore Air for any future travel.

Title: NA
Content: I fly internationally a lot. Singapore airline is in a league of its own. It's simply not comparable to any other airline. The fleet is great, but they really distinguish themselves with their exceptional service. Rather than dread 15-hour flights, I look almost look forward to them, when on Singapore Airlines. WOW!

Title: NA
Content: If you're planning a trip to Southeast Asia, hands down, Singapore Airlines is the only way to go. Also, book your vacation package through Asia Luxe Holidays. You won't regret it!!!!! We didn't! asialuxeholidays.com

Title: NA
Content: I love flying with singapore airlines. service is great. stewardess are charming. but I stopped flying with this great airlines now, because I simply could not stand that smell of curry on board. it is so overwhelming!I know SIA is proud of their services of catering to a special diet to passengers. but imagine serving salted fish or durian on board. smoking is ban on board for the comfort of other passengers more then the health reasons. why not ban food of unbearable odors ?

Title: NA
Content: So - I feel a bit ruthless about writing this review since everything that I hear about Singapore Airlines is nothing less than something along the lines of excellent, fantastic, the best in class...and such. To help explain my experience from SFO-ICN-SIN and back to SIN-ICN-SFO, I wanted to dissect my ratings into different elements:Check-in/Ticketing (4 stars) - it was fast and efficient, but nothing to be wowed about. I was glad that they put the priority sticker on my luggage. Lounge (4 stars): The SA lounge at SFO had a very nice view but the food selection really sucked. The Asiana lounge in Seoul was good and the Chani lounge was excellent.Seat (2 stars): Something really annoyed me about the seat. The seat itself was wide and when you make the bed, it became fully flat. However, the fact that you have to get up and make the bed was seriously annoying. Also, in ALL legs of my flight, the call button was not working.Food (3 stars): Again, I feel ruthless about saying this...but the food wasn't something that wowed me. In all legs, I opted for beef dishes and they tasted pretty bland. The light bites available were not interesting at all. The presentation and the dinnerware used were pretty darn good though.Drinks (4 stars): High marks for the drink selection - a wide variety of champagne, spirits, beers and wines were available. I am not quite certain how I feel about the wine selection though - they could have done better if they were so keen on advertising how the three of the world-renowed sommeliers helped with the selection. Service (4 stars): I shy away from giving 5 stars because...I don't feel that the service was genuine. Believe me, I love the service - the way they attend to you, smile at you and what not. However, I don't feel it - I don't feel that they mean it. I especially despise when they kneel down to serve you. That's not something that I'd expect from anybody and I sure as hell hope that the flight attendants are not required to do so. In conclusion: It was a good experience, but I really would not waste my money on flying business class on singapore - at all.

Title: NA
Content: After purchasing a ticket, I needed to make a change on one leg. On Monday evening, I stayed on hold for 1 hours 5 minutes, and gave up. They have an incredibly monotonous repeating messaging about Singapore Airlines being named the best airline in the world. I am sure they are not making that claim for their customer phone service.I actually decided just to go on the website to cancel the ticket; that was not possible.So, this morning, I waited on hold for 25 minutes. I was excited to get a real person, but the connection is awful. She asked me 4-5 times if I was still there. She asked for my record number; that took 3 repeats as she could not understand me -- the bad connection. After she got the reservation number down, she told me to hold while she located the reservation. OK. A couple of minutes she comes back to ask the names on the reservation. OK, another minute on hold. She then came back to ask the date of departure. Hold again. Then, she asked for my flight number, so that she could locate the reservation. Then she asked for the departure city. My god! Wouldn't all of this info be under the reservation number? I then asked to speak to a supervisor, as I had zero confidence that if she "found" my reservation that she could actually effect the needed change. I am now at 33 minutes, waiting for a supervisor. Oops, after waiting for another 20 minutes; they cut me off. :( Start over, again.Determined to get this fixed now... I called back. BUT, instead of economy travel, I selected the Kris flyer option. Got thru a lot quicker, about 5 minutes. The attendant told me that in order to change my ticket, she would have to send a note to the Singapore office for approval???? But, she gave me this direct number in Singapore to call for assistance ... (65) 6223-8888. On skype now for 10 minutes... I've got about $10 skype credits, so I'm holding until it runs out.... Still on hold 42 minutes later ..... 57 minutes. Talking to someone helpful!!1 hour, 31 minutes now . I think they have it, but have been on hold for 15 minutes now while they "process" the changes.??? World's best airline keeps playing in the recording. ??? Actually, this reminds me of the United Airlines system conversion, which was a crazy mess. Well, it's 2 hours, 1 minute and counting. They were able to get me to the point where I give my cc info. In order to do so, they transfer you to an automated number, where you enter your cc info by keypad; then you're switched back to the agent, who then "collects" your info. Unfortunately, they had a problem with my Mastercard, so he asked me to go thru the process again using my Visa. Now, I've been on hold for 10 minutes, while, I suppose, he's trying to "collect" the money from my visa. Who knows?Yahoo!!! 2 hours and 6 minutes (on this last call).. I just got my email itinerary confirmation!!

Content: When it comes to deciding on what is my most favorite Airplane & Airline for me it would be Singapore AIrlines and also the service from the Singapore Airlines Staff which was really good & very freindlyl!!! Title: NA

Title: NA
Content: A great airline, as my parents have flown to India via Singapore for nearly 20 years. I had flown via Singapore Airlines and enjoyed the experience. While I've seen lower fares on Air India or even United, I've stuck with Singapore Airlines because of the service and their footprint in India. They go to many Indian cities, as I mainly fly to South India.A note to my single friends, the flight attendants are some of the most beautiful and exquisite women I've met!!! They truly look like they came out of a magazine. They are also very helpful and courteous during the flight, which make them very classy and top-notch in my book. And the times I've had questions at SFO regarding ticketing, they've been super-helpful to myself and all my relatives who might not speak great English.The seats are very comfortable, and the in-flight entertainment system(as others have commented) is a godsend for a 16-20 hr flight.My only negative: seats can be pricey and of course it's a big jump from economy class to business class. Hopefully, one day I can afford a trip on business class. In most instances, you'll make a stop in Singapore. Tip: try to get in early that morning and leave later that day. There's lots to do in Singapore like take bus tours, rest, sleep, shop, etc. The Changi Airport is #1 in the world; an airport terminal like no other.

Title: NA
Content: Ok maybe I'm a little picky but when an airline proclaims that they are the best in the World I expect above and beyond. The food I will say is very good even for airline food. What I'm deducting a star for was that I was not informed on booking that my flight SFO-HKG did not offer miles- as much as I would have hated UAL I could have banked so many miles. Also wasn't too happy about the 200 screaming babies on this flight- I know theres not much the parents can do and I'm sympathetic but this was the longest 14 hours of my life. FA's are very professional.

Title: NA
Content: Though it was a few years ago, I had the great pleasure of using my frequent flyer miles to fly business class on Singapore to Bangkok for a cruise. It was my first experience flying on a non-U. S. carrier and I was spectacularly amazed with every aspect of the flight from beginning to end. Reception at the airport was courteous and my hours in the air were so enjoyable, they practically had to drag me off the plane. The food was exceptional, served by lovely flight attendants who anticipated every need. In Singapore, where I had to change planes and wait for two hours, I had the use of the business class lounge - filled with orchids of every hue and a range of snacks and cocktails to make the wait less tedious. I was even able to have a shower after my long flight which made my arrival in Bangkok much more pleasant after the long journey from San Francisco.Of course, I could not normally afford business class airfare but, fromwhat I've heard, economy class service with Singapore is also a cut above - and definitely ranks far superior to that of U. S. airlines. When and if I have the opportunity, there is no questions I would choose this carrier again!

Title: NA
Content: I flew with sq from sfo to sin. The flight was ok but the ground staff in sfo are vey irresponible and unwilling to help. When you get a problem, they just blame other people.

Title: NA
Content: My dad n mom have travelled in singapore airlines. So I think I am eligible to write a review.Simply amazing, superb service.They have very clean airline and quite good staff.They are really good even when you do not understand what are they talking about. I have seen most other airline crew does not even try to explain.My dad n mom are not really familiar with English, even then the staff have patient to explain them everything.I would definitely recommend singapore airlines to my friends and family.

Title: NA
Content: I try a new airline every time I get a chance. Have done Delta/United/Lufthansa. Singapore after those is heavenly. And I am not talking about the Singapore Girl :-)Extremely professional service, and comfortable throughout. If you are a mile-high couch potato, this is the long distance flight to take.The behind-the-seat thing here is not just a tv. It is a full-fledged computer, with USB ports for memory sticks. You can work view pics or work on your docs. Cool. Only thing missing was high speed net.Will definitely go back to the Singapore Girl, though I might have to give the Cathay Pacific Girl a look as well.

Title: NA
Content: I've always taken Singapore Airlines while traveling to India, and the service is quite good. The seating is ample and comfortable, the flight attendants are friendly and efficient, and you get all the basic requirements for a long flight: a hot towel at departure, free alcoholic drinks, and regularly scheduled meals, which have several options and are actually pretty tasty (I had Indian vegetarian). The in-flight entertainment was also off the hook, with more than 80 movie selections that included Bollywood and other international movies, new and old, in addition to television programming and audio selections.The only thing that sucked about our flight to Mumbai is that we had to transfer twice at Singapore and at Seoul; the Singapore one made sense because we had to go to a different plane, but at Seoul, we had to disembark with our luggage and go through customs only to re-enter the same plane within minutes.

Title: NA
Content: Singapore Air Is the best airline I have ever been on.

Title: NA
Content: my grandfather past away in december 2006.it was a very sudden death; we had just discovered he had cancer a couple of weeks prior to his death and already, my family and i had arranged to visit during the christmas holidays. we found ourselves scrambling fly back to taipei earlier. i had steeled myself to seeing him one last time, going over in my mind what i wanted to say to him and also to hopefully cheer him up with my horrible american-inflected mandarin chinese, which he always loved to poke fun at my expense and tell me what a horrible granddaughter i had become, a pox to the family name.i envisioned taking him in a rickety taiwanese taxi to snake alley, where he and i used to bond over snake meat and broth, and i would be able to urge him to eat more meat as his body needed the nourishment and protein and that snake meat made men virile and strong, using his old adages and advice when i was a young child sitting next to him on a wobbly metal stool spooning white-grey snake meat into my little mouth while he conversed with the other older men and showed off his first grandchild, a girl, a ya tou (a derogatory nickname, but used as a term of endearment in our household because it ultimately didn't matter if i was female or male, i was loved by everyone in our family). i thought about all of these things i wanted to say to him, sitting there in the international terminal at sfo. i thought about all of the times we played in the tea garden of his japanese-style tatami house, listening to him speak japanese to his colleagues and classmates from osaka. i remembered his easy transitions in chao-chou dialect, then taiwanese, then the fujian dialect and then back to mandarin. i had so much more to say to my grandfather. i sat on the plane, mostly reminiscing, mostly trying to remember, as my images had all but faded to sepia-infused clips of brief moments or sound or smells or certain repeated actions. the flight attendants knew to let me be. i think they sensed i wasn't on a pleasure voyage. i was offered water frequently, and when i stretched my legs, they were always accommodating and asked if things were ok, if i needed an extra blanket, snack or pillow. things weren't ok, but the kindness and service i experienced on this trip was actually quite touching. even though i didn't shed one single tear before, during or after my grandfather's funeral, i'm sure the impact of his death was written all over my face. he was a man who had lived an amazing and fulfilling life. my only hope is that i carry on his legacy as best i can with my broken mandarin and american attitude. i'm sure he'd be proud.

Content: I was more than pleased with the level of service, price of fare, and quality of food on my flight from San Francisco to Seoul on Singapore Airlines. I would definitely fly them again.

Title: NA
Content: The best airline hands down. They get high points for comfort, service, meals. I don't hate flying, but I actually look forward to it with Singapore. They are seriously into pampering their passengers and even the cheap seats like mine get the first class treatment. If you're flying a fifteen hour flight like I was you'll want to upgrade. And boys, be nice to the flight attendants, don't hit on them, and you'll be treated extra nice. No shit.

Title: NA
Content: Singapore airlines is the bomb, the food is good (well as good as airplane food can be), the flight attendants are nice and friendly, not too mention pretty good looking. The thing about Asian airlines is they have standards when hiring flight attendants unlike the US where there are no standards at all. Anybody who wants to be a flight attendant can be a flight attendant in the US, not so in Asia. I use to fly to HK all the time and Singapore made that long flight bearable.

Title: NA
Content: Flew from Manila to Singapore to Johannesburg...the service was flawless.

Title: NA
Content: For years I have been hearing about Singapore Airlines' excellent service so imagine my excitement when I purchased tickets from SFO to Bangkok on SA. My wife was already in Bangkok for a business trip and I was joining her to spend our holidays in Thailand and Cambodia. I had purchased an economy class ticket and my wife had a business class ticket. We were on the same flight coming back to SF.For a week prior to our departure from Thailand, and at Bangkok and Singapore airports, we tried to upgrade me to business class so my wife and I could sit together on the way back home. SA's employees refused to upgrade me and kept repeating: "you have a special fare ticket that is not eligible for upgrade". I offered to pay and they told me that I have to buy a new one-way ticket. No matter what my wife and I said they repeated the same sentence. I felt like I was dealing with robots. It got so frustrating that I lost my patience a couple of times, and I'm known for patient! I do understand that they are not required to upgrade me but SA is the first airline EVER who has refused to upgrade my ticket. Even worse, in Singapore airport, they let my wife into the lounge and they kicked me out! They said: "Lounge is for business class customers only" I offered to pay and they refused! I have never been so humiliated in my life!!! Another incident...in Bangkok airport, our baggage was 2 kilos over and they made us take stuff out of our suitcases to bring the weight down. I offered to pay for the extra weight, again no luck. I should mention that every time that I offered to pay for something the SA employees got very irritated with me. I couldn't quite understand why (probably has to do with: "Damn Americans, they thing they can buy everything").I do agree that their inflight service is good but any other kind of customer service is non existent. Their employees (not the cabin crew) have a militant attitude and refuse to listen to the customer. They have been programmed to say and do the exact same thing, no matter what the circumstance are. I work for a company that is known worldwide for customer service and I have to tell you that I was very disappointed with SA's customer service, especially having high expectations. My wife and I are contemplating whether we should ever fly SA again. As of right now, our vote is a definite "no".

Title: NA
Content: SQ is #1, no competition. Worth every penny every time. I've flown multiple trips to HKG and ICN (the new 77W to ICN/SIN is unreal-good) and have never been disappointed. Sure the inflight service is robotic at times, but it's spot-on robotic. I've tried UA, Asiana, and KAL and I'd take Asiana again if my SQ were booked full.
